mina.title: Mina
mina.description: Socket level networking using TCP or UDP with Apache Mina 2.x.

host.description: Hostname to use. Use localhost or 0.0.0.0 for local server as consumer. For producer use the hostname or ip address of the remote server.
host.title: Host

port.description: Port number
port.title: Port

disconnect.description: Whether to disconnect(close) from Mina session right after use. Can be used for both consumer and producer.
disconnect.title: Disconnect

minaLogger.description: You can enable the Apache MINA logging filter. Apache MINA uses slf4j logging at INFO level to log all input and output.
minaLogger.title: Mina Logger

sync.description: Setting to set endpoint as one-way or request-response.
sync.title: Sync

timeout.description: You can configure the timeout that specifies how long to wait for a response from a remote server. The timeout unit is in milliseconds, so 60000 is 60 seconds.
timeout.title: Timeout

writeTimeout.description: Maximum amount of time it should take to send data to the MINA session. Default is 10000 milliseconds.
writeTimeout.title: Write Timeout

clientMode.description: If the clientMode is true, mina consumer will connect the address as a TCP client.
clientMode.title: Client Mode

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

noReplyLogLevel.description: If sync is enabled this option dictates MinaConsumer which logging level to use when logging a there is no reply to send back.
noReplyLogLevel.title: No Reply Log Level

cachedAddress.description: Whether to create the InetAddress once and reuse. Setting this to false allows to pickup DNS changes in the network.
cachedAddress.title: Cached Address

lazySessionCreation.description: Sessions can be lazily created to avoid exceptions, if the remote server is not up and running when the Camel producer is started.
lazySessionCreation.title: Lazy Session Creation

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

disconnectOnNoReply.description: If sync is enabled then this option dictates MinaConsumer if it should disconnect where there is no reply to send back.
disconnectOnNoReply.title: Disconnect On No Reply

maximumPoolSize.description: Number of worker threads in the worker pool for TCP and UDP
maximumPoolSize.title: Maximum Pool Size

orderedThreadPoolExecutor.description: Whether to use ordered thread pool, to ensure events are processed orderly on the same channel.
orderedThreadPoolExecutor.title: Ordered Thread Pool Executor

transferExchange.description: Only used for TCP. You can transfer the exchange over the wire instead of just the body. The following fields are transferred: In body, Out body, fault body, In headers, Out headers, fault headers, exchange properties, exchange exception. This requires that the objects are serializable. Camel will exclude any non-serializable objects and log it at WARN level.
transferExchange.title: Transfer Exchange

allowDefaultCodec.description: The mina component installs a default codec if both, codec is null and textline is false. Setting allowDefaultCodec to false prevents the mina component from installing a default codec as the first element in the filter chain. This is useful in scenarios where another filter must be the first in the filter chain, like the SSL filter.
allowDefaultCodec.title: Allow Default Codec

codec.description: To use a custom minda codec implementation.
codec.title: Codec

decoderMaxLineLength.description: To set the textline protocol decoder max line length. By default the default value of Mina itself is used which are 1024.
decoderMaxLineLength.title: Decoder Max Line Length

encoderMaxLineLength.description: To set the textline protocol encoder max line length. By default the default value of Mina itself is used which are Integer.MAX_VALUE.
encoderMaxLineLength.title: Encoder Max Line Length

encoding.description: You can configure the encoding (a charset name) to use for the TCP textline codec and the UDP protocol. If not provided, Camel will use the JVM default Charset
encoding.title: Encoding

filters.description: You can set a list of Mina IoFilters to use.
filters.title: Filters

textline.description: Only used for TCP. If no codec is specified, you can use this flag to indicate a text line based codec; if not specified or the value is false, then Object Serialization is assumed over TCP.
textline.title: Textline

textlineDelimiter.description: Only used for TCP and if textline=true. Sets the text line delimiter to use. If none provided, Camel will use DEFAULT. This delimiter is used to mark the end of text.
textlineDelimiter.title: Textline Delimiter

autoStartTls.description: Whether to auto start SSL handshake.
autoStartTls.title: Auto Start Tls

minio.title: Minio
minio.description: Store and retrieve objects from Minio Storage Service using Minio SDK.

autoCreateBucket.description: Setting the autocreation of the bucket if bucket name not exist.
autoCreateBucket.title: Auto Create Bucket

customHttpClient.description: Set custom HTTP client for authenticated access.
customHttpClient.title: Custom Http Client

endpoint.description: Endpoint can be an URL, domain name, IPv4 address or IPv6 address.
endpoint.title: Endpoint

minioClient.description: Reference to a Minio Client object in the registry.
minioClient.title: Minio Client

policy.description: The policy for this queue to set in the method.
policy.title: Policy

proxyPort.description: TCP/IP port number. 80 and 443 are used as defaults for HTTP and HTTPS.
proxyPort.title: Proxy Port

region.description: The region in which Minio client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1). You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()
region.title: Region

secure.description: Flag to indicate to use secure connection to minio service or not.
secure.title: Secure

serverSideEncryptionCustomerKey.description: Server-side encryption for source object while copy/move objects.
serverSideEncryptionCustomerKey.title: Server Side Encryption Customer Key

autoCloseBody.description: If this option is true and includeBody is true, then the MinioObject.close() method will be called on exchange completion. This option is strongly related to includeBody option. In case of setting includeBody to true and autocloseBody to false, it will be up to the caller to close the MinioObject stream. Setting autocloseBody to true, will close the MinioObject stream automatically.
autoCloseBody.title: Auto Close Body

bypassGovernanceMode.description: Set this flag if you want to bypassGovernanceMode when deleting a particular object.
bypassGovernanceMode.title: Bypass Governance Mode

deleteAfterRead.description: Delete objects from Minio after they have been retrieved. The delete is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs, the object is not deleted. If this option is false, then the same objects will be retrieve over and over again on the polls. Therefore you need to use the Idempotent Consumer EIP in the route to filter out duplicates. You can filter using the MinioConstants#BUCKET_NAME and MinioConstants#OBJECT_NAME headers, or only the MinioConstants#OBJECT_NAME header.
deleteAfterRead.title: Delete After Read

delimiter.description: The delimiter which is used in the ListObjectsRequest to only consume objects we are interested in.
delimiter.title: Delimiter

includeBody.description: If it is true, the exchange body will be set to a stream to the contents of the file. If false, the headers will be set with the Minio object metadata, but the body will be null. This option is strongly related to autocloseBody option. In case of setting includeBody to true and autocloseBody to false, it will be up to the caller to close the MinioObject stream. Setting autocloseBody to true, will close the MinioObject stream automatically.
includeBody.title: Include Body

includeFolders.description: The flag which is used in the ListObjectsRequest to set include folders.
includeFolders.title: Include Folders

includeUserMetadata.description: The flag which is used in the ListObjectsRequest to get objects with user meta data.
includeUserMetadata.title: Include User Metadata

includeVersions.description: The flag which is used in the ListObjectsRequest to get objects with versioning.
includeVersions.title: Include Versions

length.description: Number of bytes of object data from offset.
length.title: Length

matchETag.description: Set match ETag parameter for get object(s).
matchETag.title: Match ETag

maxConnections.description: Set the maxConnections parameter in the minio client configuration
maxConnections.title: Max Connections

maxMessagesPerPoll.description: Gets the maximum number of messages as a limit to poll at each polling. Gets the maximum number of messages as a limit to poll at each polling. The default value is 10. Use 0 or a negative number to set it as unlimited.
maxMessagesPerPoll.title: Max Messages Per Poll

modifiedSince.description: Set modified since parameter for get object(s).
modifiedSince.title: Modified Since

moveAfterRead.description: Move objects from bucket to a different bucket after they have been retrieved. To accomplish the operation the destinationBucket option must be set. The copy bucket operation is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs, the object is not moved.
moveAfterRead.title: Move After Read

notMatchETag.description: Set not match ETag parameter for get object(s).
notMatchETag.title: Not Match ETag

objectName.description: To get the object from the bucket with the given object name.
objectName.title: Object Name

offset.description: Start byte position of object data.
offset.title: Offset

recursive.description: List recursively than directory structure emulation.
recursive.title: Recursive

sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.
sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.title: Send Empty Message When Idle

startAfter.description: list objects in bucket after this object name.
startAfter.title: Start After

unModifiedSince.description: Set un modified since parameter for get object(s).
unModifiedSince.title: Un Modified Since

useVersion1.description: when true, version 1 of REST API is used.
useVersion1.title: Use Version1

versionId.description: Set specific version_ID of a object when deleting the object.
versionId.title: Version Id

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.
pollStrategy.title: Poll Strategy

deleteAfterWrite.description: Delete file object after the Minio file has been uploaded.
deleteAfterWrite.title: Delete After Write

keyName.description: Setting the key name for an element in the bucket through endpoint parameter.
keyName.title: Key Name

operation.description: The operation to do in case the user don't want to do only an upload.
operation.title: Operation

pojoRequest.description: If we want to use a POJO request as body or not.
pojoRequest.title: Pojo Request

storageClass.description: The storage class to set in the request.
storageClass.title: Storage Class

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

backoffErrorThreshold.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.
backoffErrorThreshold.title: Backoff Error Threshold

backoffIdleThreshold.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.
backoffIdleThreshold.title: Backoff Idle Threshold

backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.
backoffMultiplier.title: Backoff Multiplier

greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.
greedy.title: Greedy

initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.
initialDelay.title: Initial Delay

repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.
repeatCount.title: Repeat Count

runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.
runLoggingLevel.title: Run Logging Level

scheduledExecutorService.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.
scheduledExecutorService.title: Scheduled Executor Service

scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler
scheduler.title: Scheduler

schedulerProperties.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.
schedulerProperties.title: Scheduler Properties

startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.
startScheduler.title: Start Scheduler

timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.
timeUnit.title: Time Unit

useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.
useFixedDelay.title: Use Fixed Delay

accessKey.description: Amazon AWS Secret Access Key or Minio Access Key. If not set camel will connect to service for anonymous access.
accessKey.title: Access Key

secretKey.description: Amazon AWS Access Key Id or Minio Secret Key. If not set camel will connect to service for anonymous access.
secretKey.title: Secret Key

mllp.title: MLLP
mllp.description: Communicate with external systems using the MLLP protocol.

hostname.description: Hostname or IP for connection for the TCP connection. The default value is null, which means any local IP address
hostname.title: Hostname

port.description: Port number for the TCP connection
port.title: Port

autoAck.description: Enable/Disable the automatic generation of a MLLP Acknowledgement MLLP Consumers only
autoAck.title: Auto Ack

charsetName.description: Sets the default charset to use
charsetName.title: Charset Name

hl7Headers.description: Enable/Disable the automatic generation of message headers from the HL7 Message MLLP Consumers only
hl7Headers.title: Hl7 Headers

requireEndOfData.description: Enable/Disable strict compliance to the MLLP standard. The MLLP standard specifies START_OF_BLOCKhl7 payloadEND_OF_BLOCKEND_OF_DATA, however, some systems do not send the final END_OF_DATA byte. This setting controls whether or not the final END_OF_DATA byte is required or optional.
requireEndOfData.title: Require End Of Data

stringPayload.description: Enable/Disable converting the payload to a String. If enabled, HL7 Payloads received from external systems will be validated converted to a String. If the charsetName property is set, that character set will be used for the conversion. If the charsetName property is not set, the value of MSH-18 will be used to determine th appropriate character set. If MSH-18 is not set, then the default ISO-8859-1 character set will be use.
stringPayload.title: String Payload

validatePayload.description: Enable/Disable the validation of HL7 Payloads If enabled, HL7 Payloads received from external systems will be validated (see Hl7Util.generateInvalidPayloadExceptionMessage for details on the validation). If and invalid payload is detected, a MllpInvalidMessageException (for consumers) or a MllpInvalidAcknowledgementException will be thrown.
validatePayload.title: Validate Payload

acceptTimeout.description: Timeout (in milliseconds) while waiting for a TCP connection TCP Server Only
acceptTimeout.title: Accept Timeout

backlog.description: The maximum queue length for incoming connection indications (a request to connect) is set to the backlog parameter. If a connection indication arrives when the queue is full, the connection is refused.
backlog.title: Backlog

bindRetryInterval.description: TCP Server Only - The number of milliseconds to wait between bind attempts
bindRetryInterval.title: Bind Retry Interval

bindTimeout.description: TCP Server Only - The number of milliseconds to retry binding to a server port
bindTimeout.title: Bind Timeout

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to receive incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. If disabled, the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions by logging them at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

lenientBind.description: TCP Server Only - Allow the endpoint to start before the TCP ServerSocket is bound. In some environments, it may be desirable to allow the endpoint to start before the TCP ServerSocket is bound.
lenientBind.title: Lenient Bind

maxConcurrentConsumers.description: The maximum number of concurrent MLLP Consumer connections that will be allowed. If a new connection is received and the maximum is number are already established, the new connection will be reset immediately.
maxConcurrentConsumers.title: Max Concurrent Consumers

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

connectTimeout.description: Timeout (in milliseconds) for establishing for a TCP connection TCP Client only
connectTimeout.title: Connect Timeout

idleTimeoutStrategy.description: decide what action to take when idle timeout occurs. Possible values are : RESET: set SO_LINGER to 0 and reset the socket CLOSE: close the socket gracefully default is RESET.
idleTimeoutStrategy.title: Idle Timeout Strategy

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

maxBufferSize.description: Maximum buffer size used when receiving or sending data over the wire.
maxBufferSize.title: Max Buffer Size

minBufferSize.description: Minimum buffer size used when receiving or sending data over the wire.
minBufferSize.title: Min Buffer Size

readTimeout.description: The SO_TIMEOUT value (in milliseconds) used after the start of an MLLP frame has been received
readTimeout.title: Read Timeout

receiveBufferSize.description: Sets the SO_RCVBUF option to the specified value (in bytes)
receiveBufferSize.title: Receive Buffer Size

receiveTimeout.description: The SO_TIMEOUT value (in milliseconds) used when waiting for the start of an MLLP frame
receiveTimeout.title: Receive Timeout

sendBufferSize.description: Sets the SO_SNDBUF option to the specified value (in bytes)
sendBufferSize.title: Send Buffer Size

idleTimeout.description: The approximate idle time allowed before the Client TCP Connection will be reset. A null value or a value less than or equal to zero will disable the idle timeout.
idleTimeout.title: Idle Timeout

mock.title: Mock
mock.description: Test routes and mediation rules using mocks.

assertPeriod.description: Sets a grace period after which the mock endpoint will re-assert to ensure the preliminary assertion is still valid. This is used for example to assert that exactly a number of messages arrives. For example if expected count was set to 5, then the assertion is satisfied when 5 or more message arrives. To ensure that exactly 5 messages arrives, then you would need to wait a little period to ensure no further message arrives. This is what you can use this method for. By default this period is disabled.
assertPeriod.title: Assert Period

expectedCount.description: Specifies the expected number of message exchanges that should be received by this endpoint. Beware: If you want to expect that 0 messages, then take extra care, as 0 matches when the tests starts, so you need to set a assert period time to let the test run for a while to make sure there are still no messages arrived; for that use setAssertPeriod(long). An alternative is to use NotifyBuilder, and use the notifier to know when Camel is done routing some messages, before you call the assertIsSatisfied() method on the mocks. This allows you to not use a fixed assert period, to speedup testing times. If you want to assert that exactly n'th message arrives to this mock endpoint, then see also the setAssertPeriod(long) method for further details.
expectedCount.title: Expected Count

failFast.description: Sets whether assertIsSatisfied() should fail fast at the first detected failed expectation while it may otherwise wait for all expected messages to arrive before performing expectations verifications. Is by default true. Set to false to use behavior as in Camel 2.x.
failFast.title: Fail Fast

log.description: To turn on logging when the mock receives an incoming message. This will log only one time at INFO level for the incoming message. For more detailed logging then set the logger to DEBUG level for the org.apache.camel.component.mock.MockEndpoint class.
log.title: Log

reportGroup.description: A number that is used to turn on throughput logging based on groups of the size.
reportGroup.title: Report Group

resultMinimumWaitTime.description: Sets the minimum expected amount of time (in millis) the assertIsSatisfied() will wait on a latch until it is satisfied
resultMinimumWaitTime.title: Result Minimum Wait Time

resultWaitTime.description: Sets the maximum amount of time (in millis) the assertIsSatisfied() will wait on a latch until it is satisfied
resultWaitTime.title: Result Wait Time

retainFirst.description: Specifies to only retain the first n'th number of received Exchanges. This is used when testing with big data, to reduce memory consumption by not storing copies of every Exchange this mock endpoint receives. Important: When using this limitation, then the getReceivedCounter() will still return the actual number of received Exchanges. For example if we have received 5000 Exchanges, and have configured to only retain the first 10 Exchanges, then the getReceivedCounter() will still return 5000 but there is only the first 10 Exchanges in the getExchanges() and getReceivedExchanges() methods. When using this method, then some of the other expectation methods is not supported, for example the expectedBodiesReceived(Object...) sets a expectation on the first number of bodies received. You can configure both setRetainFirst(int) and setRetainLast(int) methods, to limit both the first and last received.
retainFirst.title: Retain First

retainLast.description: Specifies to only retain the last n'th number of received Exchanges. This is used when testing with big data, to reduce memory consumption by not storing copies of every Exchange this mock endpoint receives. Important: When using this limitation, then the getReceivedCounter() will still return the actual number of received Exchanges. For example if we have received 5000 Exchanges, and have configured to only retain the last 20 Exchanges, then the getReceivedCounter() will still return 5000 but there is only the last 20 Exchanges in the getExchanges() and getReceivedExchanges() methods. When using this method, then some of the other expectation methods is not supported, for example the expectedBodiesReceived(Object...) sets a expectation on the first number of bodies received. You can configure both setRetainFirst(int) and setRetainLast(int) methods, to limit both the first and last received.
retainLast.title: Retain Last

sleepForEmptyTest.description: Allows a sleep to be specified to wait to check that this endpoint really is empty when expectedMessageCount(int) is called with zero
sleepForEmptyTest.title: Sleep For Empty Test

copyOnExchange.description: Sets whether to make a deep copy of the incoming Exchange when received at this mock endpoint. Is by default true.
copyOnExchange.title: Copy On Exchange

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

mongodb.title: MongoDB
mongodb.description: Perform operations on MongoDB documents and collections.

connectionBean.description: Sets the connection bean reference used to lookup a client for connecting to a database if no hosts parameter is present.
connectionBean.title: Connection Bean

collection.description: Sets the name of the MongoDB collection to bind to this endpoint
collection.title: Collection

collectionIndex.description: Sets the collection index (JSON FORMAT : { field1 : order1, field2 : order2})
collectionIndex.title: Collection Index

createCollection.description: Create collection during initialisation if it doesn't exist. Default is true.
createCollection.title: Create Collection

database.description: Sets the name of the MongoDB database to target
database.title: Database

hosts.description: Host address of mongodb server in host:port format. It's possible also use more than one address, as comma separated list of hosts: host1:port1,host2:port2. If the hosts parameter is specified, the provided connectionBean is ignored.
hosts.title: Hosts

mongoConnection.description: Sets the connection bean used as a client for connecting to a database.
mongoConnection.title: Mongo Connection

operation.description: Sets the operation this endpoint will execute against MongoDB.
operation.title: Operation

outputType.description: Convert the output of the producer to the selected type : DocumentList Document or MongoIterable. DocumentList or MongoIterable applies to findAll and aggregate. Document applies to all other operations.
outputType.title: Output Type

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

cursorRegenerationDelay.description: MongoDB tailable cursors will block until new data arrives. If no new data is inserted, after some time the cursor will be automatically freed and closed by the MongoDB server. The client is expected to regenerate the cursor if needed. This value specifies the time to wait before attempting to fetch a new cursor, and if the attempt fails, how long before the next attempt is made. Default value is 1000ms.
cursorRegenerationDelay.title: Cursor Regeneration Delay

dynamicity.description: Sets whether this endpoint will attempt to dynamically resolve the target database and collection from the incoming Exchange properties. Can be used to override at runtime the database and collection specified on the otherwise static endpoint URI. It is disabled by default to boost performance. Enabling it will take a minimal performance hit.
dynamicity.title: Dynamicity

readPreference.description: Configure how MongoDB clients route read operations to the members of a replica set. Possible values are PRIMARY, PRIMARY_PREFERRED, SECONDARY, SECONDARY_PREFERRED or NEAREST
readPreference.title: Read Preference

writeConcern.description: Configure the connection bean with the level of acknowledgment requested from MongoDB for write operations to a standalone mongod, replicaset or cluster. Possible values are ACKNOWLEDGED, W1, W2, W3, UNACKNOWLEDGED, JOURNALED or MAJORITY.
writeConcern.title: Write Concern

writeResultAsHeader.description: In write operations, it determines whether instead of returning WriteResult as the body of the OUT message, we transfer the IN message to the OUT and attach the WriteResult as a header.
writeResultAsHeader.title: Write Result As Header

streamFilter.description: Filter condition for change streams consumer.
streamFilter.title: Stream Filter

authSource.description: The database name associated with the user's credentials.
authSource.title: Auth Source

persistentId.description: One tail tracking collection can host many trackers for several tailable consumers. To keep them separate, each tracker should have its own unique persistentId.
persistentId.title: Persistent Id

persistentTailTracking.description: Enable persistent tail tracking, which is a mechanism to keep track of the last consumed message across system restarts. The next time the system is up, the endpoint will recover the cursor from the point where it last stopped slurping records.
persistentTailTracking.title: Persistent Tail Tracking

tailTrackCollection.description: Collection where tail tracking information will be persisted. If not specified, MongoDbTailTrackingConfig#DEFAULT_COLLECTION will be used by default.
tailTrackCollection.title: Tail Track Collection

tailTrackDb.description: Indicates what database the tail tracking mechanism will persist to. If not specified, the current database will be picked by default. Dynamicity will not be taken into account even if enabled, i.e. the tail tracking database will not vary past endpoint initialisation.
tailTrackDb.title: Tail Track Db

tailTrackField.description: Field where the last tracked value will be placed. If not specified, MongoDbTailTrackingConfig#DEFAULT_FIELD will be used by default.
tailTrackField.title: Tail Track Field

tailTrackIncreasingField.description: Correlation field in the incoming record which is of increasing nature and will be used to position the tailing cursor every time it is generated. The cursor will be (re)created with a query of type: tailTrackIncreasingField greater than lastValue (possibly recovered from persistent tail tracking). Can be of type Integer, Date, String, etc. NOTE: No support for dot notation at the current time, so the field should be at the top level of the document.
tailTrackIncreasingField.title: Tail Track Increasing Field

bucket.description: Sets the name of the GridFS bucket within the database. Default is fs.
bucket.title: Bucket

database.description: Sets the name of the MongoDB database to target
database.title: Database

readPreference.description: Sets a MongoDB ReadPreference on the Mongo connection. Read preferences set directly on the connection will be overridden by this setting. The com.mongodb.ReadPreference#valueOf(String) utility method is used to resolve the passed readPreference value. Some examples for the possible values are nearest, primary or secondary etc.
readPreference.title: Read Preference

writeConcern.description: Set the WriteConcern for write operations on MongoDB using the standard ones. Resolved from the fields of the WriteConcern class by calling the WriteConcern#valueOf(String) method.
writeConcern.title: Write Concern

delay.description: Sets the delay between polls within the Consumer. Default is 500ms
delay.title: Delay

fileAttributeName.description: If the QueryType uses a FileAttribute, this sets the name of the attribute that is used. Default is camel-processed.
fileAttributeName.title: File Attribute Name

initialDelay.description: Sets the initialDelay before the consumer will start polling. Default is 1000ms
initialDelay.title: Initial Delay

persistentTSCollection.description: If the QueryType uses a persistent timestamp, this sets the name of the collection within the DB to store the timestamp.
persistentTSCollection.title: Persistent TSCollection

persistentTSObject.description: If the QueryType uses a persistent timestamp, this is the ID of the object in the collection to store the timestamp.
persistentTSObject.title: Persistent TSObject

query.description: Additional query parameters (in JSON) that are used to configure the query used for finding files in the GridFsConsumer
query.title: Query

queryStrategy.description: Sets the QueryStrategy that is used for polling for new files. Default is Timestamp
queryStrategy.title: Query Strategy

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

operation.description: Sets the operation this endpoint will execute against GridFs.
operation.title: Operation

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

mustache.title: Mustache
mustache.description: Transform messages using a Mustache template.

resourceUri.description: Path to the resource. You can prefix with: classpath, file, http, ref, or bean. classpath, file and http loads the resource using these protocols (classpath is default). ref will lookup the resource in the registry. bean will call a method on a bean to be used as the resource. For bean you can specify the method name after dot, eg bean:myBean.myMethod.
resourceUri.title: Resource Uri

allowContextMapAll.description: Sets whether the context map should allow access to all details. By default only the message body and headers can be accessed. This option can be enabled for full access to the current Exchange and CamelContext. Doing so impose a potential security risk as this opens access to the full power of CamelContext API.
allowContextMapAll.title: Allow Context Map All

allowTemplateFromHeader.description: Whether to allow to use resource template from header or not (default false). Enabling this allows to specify dynamic templates via message header. However this can be seen as a potential security vulnerability if the header is coming from a malicious user, so use this with care.
allowTemplateFromHeader.title: Allow Template From Header

contentCache.description: Sets whether to use resource content cache or not
contentCache.title: Content Cache

encoding.description: Character encoding of the resource content.
encoding.title: Encoding

endDelimiter.description: Characters used to mark template code end.
endDelimiter.title: End Delimiter

startDelimiter.description: Characters used to mark template code beginning.
startDelimiter.title: Start Delimiter

By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
