sslClientProps.description: Sets the SSL properties for the connection. Note that these properties are only valid if an implementation of the Java Secure Socket Extensions (JSSE) is available. These properties are not used if a custom SocketFactory has been set. The following properties can be used: com.ibm.ssl.protocol One of: SSL, SSLv3, TLS, TLSv1, SSL_TLS. com.ibm.ssl.contextProvider Underlying JSSE provider. For example IBMJSSE2 or SunJSSE com.ibm.ssl.keyStore The name of the file that contains the KeyStore object that you want the KeyManager to use. For example /mydir/etc/key.p12 com.ibm.ssl.keyStorePassword The password for the KeyStore object that you want the KeyManager to use. The password can either be in plain-text, or may be obfuscated using the static method: com.ibm.micro.security.Password.obfuscate(char password). This obfuscates the password using a simple and insecure XOR and Base64 encoding mechanism. Note that this is only a simple scrambler to obfuscate clear-text passwords. com.ibm.ssl.keyStoreType Type of key store, for example PKCS12, JKS, or JCEKS. com.ibm.ssl.keyStoreProvider Key store provider, for example IBMJCE or IBMJCEFIPS. com.ibm.ssl.trustStore The name of the file that contains the KeyStore object that you want the TrustManager to use. com.ibm.ssl.trustStorePassword The password for the TrustStore object that you want the TrustManager to use. The password can either be in plain-text, or may be obfuscated using the static method: com.ibm.micro.security.Password.obfuscate(char password). This obfuscates the password using a simple and insecure XOR and Base64 encoding mechanism. Note that this is only a simple scrambler to obfuscate clear-text passwords. com.ibm.ssl.trustStoreType The type of KeyStore object that you want the default TrustManager to use. Same possible values as keyStoreType. com.ibm.ssl.trustStoreProvider Trust store provider, for example IBMJCE or IBMJCEFIPS. com.ibm.ssl.enabledCipherSuites A list of which ciphers are enabled. Values are dependent on the provider, for example: SSL_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA;SSL_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA. com.ibm.ssl.keyManager Sets the algorithm that will be used to instantiate a KeyManagerFactory object instead of using the default algorithm available in the platform. Example values: IbmX509 or IBMJ9X509. com.ibm.ssl.trustManager Sets the algorithm that will be used to instantiate a TrustManagerFactory object instead of using the default algorithm available in the platform. Example values: PKIX or IBMJ9X509.
sslClientProps.title: Ssl Client Props

sslHostnameVerifier.description: Sets the HostnameVerifier for the SSL connection. Note that it will be used after handshake on a connection and you should do actions by yourself when hostname is verified error. There is no default HostnameVerifier
sslHostnameVerifier.title: Ssl Hostname Verifier

userName.description: Username to be used for authentication against the MQTT broker
userName.title: User Name

pdf.title: PDF
pdf.description: Create, modify or extract content from PDF documents.

operation.description: Operation type
operation.title: Operation

textProcessingFactory.description: Text processing to use. autoFormatting: Text is getting sliced by words, then max amount of words that fits in the line will be written into pdf document. With this strategy all words that doesn't fit in the line will be moved to the new line. lineTermination: Builds set of classes for line-termination writing strategy. Text getting sliced by line termination symbol and then it will be written regardless it fits in the line or not.
textProcessingFactory.title: Text Processing Factory

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

pg-replication-slot.title: PostgresSQL Replication Slot
pg-replication-slot.description: Poll for PostgreSQL Write-Ahead Log (WAL) records using Streaming Replication Slots.

port.description: Postgres port
port.title: Port

sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.
sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.title: Send Empty Message When Idle

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.
pollStrategy.title: Poll Strategy

autoCreateSlot.description: Auto create slot if it does not exist
autoCreateSlot.title: Auto Create Slot

slotOptions.description: Slot options to be passed to the output plugin.
slotOptions.title: Slot Options

statusInterval.description: Specifies the number of seconds between status packets sent back to Postgres server.
statusInterval.title: Status Interval

backoffErrorThreshold.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.
backoffErrorThreshold.title: Backoff Error Threshold

backoffIdleThreshold.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.
backoffIdleThreshold.title: Backoff Idle Threshold

backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.
backoffMultiplier.title: Backoff Multiplier

greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.
greedy.title: Greedy

initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.
initialDelay.title: Initial Delay

repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.
repeatCount.title: Repeat Count

runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.
runLoggingLevel.title: Run Logging Level

scheduledExecutorService.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.
scheduledExecutorService.title: Scheduled Executor Service

scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler
scheduler.title: Scheduler

schedulerProperties.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.
schedulerProperties.title: Scheduler Properties

startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.
startScheduler.title: Start Scheduler

timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.
timeUnit.title: Time Unit

useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.
useFixedDelay.title: Use Fixed Delay

datasource.description: To connect using the given javax.sql.DataSource instead of using hostname and port.

platform-http.description: Expose HTTP endpoints using the HTTP server available in the current platform.

path.description: The path under which this endpoint serves the HTTP requests, for proxy use 'proxy'
path.title: Path

consumes.description: The content type this endpoint accepts as an input, such as application/xml or application/json. null or */* mean no restriction.
consumes.title: Consumes

httpMethodRestrict.description: A comma separated list of HTTP methods to serve, e.g. GET,POST . If no methods are specified, all methods will be served.
httpMethodRestrict.title: Http Method Restrict

matchOnUriPrefix.description: Whether or not the consumer should try to find a target consumer by matching the URI prefix if no exact match is found.
matchOnUriPrefix.title: Match On Uri Prefix

muteException.description: If enabled and an Exchange failed processing on the consumer side the response's body won't contain the exception's stack trace.
muteException.title: Mute Exception

produces.description: The content type this endpoint produces, such as application/xml or application/json.
produces.title: Produces

fileNameExtWhitelist.description: A comma or whitespace separated list of file extensions. Uploads having these extensions will be stored locally. Null value or asterisk () will allow all files.

headerFilterStrategy.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter headers to and from Camel message.

trigger.title: Trigger

pop3.title: POP3
pop3.description: Send and receive emails using imap, pop3 and smtp protocols.

port.description: The port number of the mail server
port.title: Port

closeFolder.description: Whether the consumer should close the folder after polling. Setting this option to false and having disconnect=false as well, then the consumer keep the folder open between polls.
closeFolder.title: Close Folder

copyTo.description: After processing a mail message, it can be copied to a mail folder with the given name. You can override this configuration value, with a header with the key copyTo, allowing you to copy messages to folder names configured at runtime.
copyTo.title: Copy To

decodeFilename.description: If set to true, the MimeUtility.decodeText method will be used to decode the filename. This is similar to setting JVM system property mail.mime.encodefilename.
decodeFilename.title: Decode Filename

delete.description: Deletes the messages after they have been processed. This is done by setting the DELETED flag on the mail message. If false, the SEEN flag is set instead. As of Camel 2.10 you can override this configuration option by setting a header with the key delete to determine if the mail should be deleted or not.
delete.title: Delete

disconnect.description: Whether the consumer should disconnect after polling. If enabled this forces Camel to connect on each poll.
disconnect.title: Disconnect

handleFailedMessage.description: If the mail consumer cannot retrieve a given mail message, then this option allows to handle the caused exception by the consumer's error handler. By enable the bridge error handler on the consumer, then the Camel routing error handler can handle the exception instead. The default behavior would be the consumer throws an exception and no mails from the batch would be able to be routed by Camel.
handleFailedMessage.title: Handle Failed Message

maxMessagesPerPoll.description: Specifies the maximum number of messages to gather per poll. By default, no maximum is set. Can be used to set a limit of e.g. 1000 to avoid downloading thousands of files when the server starts up. Set a value of 0 or negative to disable this option.
maxMessagesPerPoll.title: Max Messages Per Poll

mimeDecodeHeaders.description: This option enables transparent MIME decoding and unfolding for mail headers.
mimeDecodeHeaders.title: Mime Decode Headers

moveTo.description: After processing a mail message, it can be moved to a mail folder with the given name. You can override this configuration value, with a header with the key moveTo, allowing you to move messages to folder names configured at runtime.
moveTo.title: Move To

peek.description: Will mark the javax.mail.Message as peeked before processing the mail message. This applies to IMAPMessage messages types only. By using peek the mail will not be eager marked as SEEN on the mail server, which allows us to rollback the mail message if there is an error processing in Camel.
peek.title: Peek

sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.
sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.title: Send Empty Message When Idle

skipFailedMessage.description: If the mail consumer cannot retrieve a given mail message, then this option allows to skip the message and move on to retrieve the next mail message. The default behavior would be the consumer throws an exception and no mails from the batch would be able to be routed by Camel.
skipFailedMessage.title: Skip Failed Message

unseen.description: Whether to limit by unseen mails only.
unseen.title: Unseen

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

failOnDuplicateFileAttachment.description: Whether to fail processing the mail if the mail message contains attachments with duplicate file names. If set to false, then the duplicate attachment is skipped and a WARN is logged. If set to true then an exception is thrown failing to process the mail message.
failOnDuplicateFileAttachment.title: Fail On Duplicate File Attachment

fetchSize.description: Sets the maximum number of messages to consume during a poll. This can be used to avoid overloading a mail server, if a mailbox folder contains a lot of messages. Default value of -1 means no fetch size and all messages will be consumed. Setting the value to 0 is a special corner case, where Camel will not consume any messages at all.
fetchSize.title: Fetch Size

generateMissingAttachmentNames.description: Set this to 'uuid' to set a UUID for the filename of the attachment if no filename was set
generateMissingAttachmentNames.title: Generate Missing Attachment Names

handleDuplicateAttachmentNames.description: Set the strategy to handle duplicate filenames of attachments never: attachments that have a filename which is already present in the attachments will be ignored unless failOnDuplicateFileAttachment is set to true. uuidPrefix: this will prefix the duplicate attachment filenames each with a uuid and underscore (uuid_filename.fileextension). uuidSuffix: this will suffix the duplicate attachment filenames each with a underscore and uuid (filename_uuid.fileextension).
handleDuplicateAttachmentNames.title: Handle Duplicate Attachment Names

mailUidGenerator.description: A pluggable MailUidGenerator that allows to use custom logic to generate UUID of the mail message.
mailUidGenerator.title: Mail Uid Generator

mapMailMessage.description: Specifies whether Camel should map the received mail message to Camel body/headers/attachments. If set to true, the body of the mail message is mapped to the body of the Camel IN message, the mail headers are mapped to IN headers, and the attachments to Camel IN attachment message. If this option is set to false then the IN message contains a raw javax.mail.Message. You can retrieve this raw message by calling exchange.getIn().getBody(javax.mail.Message.class).
mapMailMessage.title: Map Mail Message

pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.
pollStrategy.title: Poll Strategy

postProcessAction.description: Refers to an MailBoxPostProcessAction for doing post processing tasks on the mailbox once the normal processing ended.
postProcessAction.title: Post Process Action

bcc.description: Sets the BCC email address. Separate multiple email addresses with comma.
bcc.title: Bcc

cc.description: Sets the CC email address. Separate multiple email addresses with comma.
cc.title: Cc

replyTo.description: The Reply-To recipients (the receivers of the response mail). Separate multiple email addresses with a comma.
replyTo.title: Reply To

subject.description: The Subject of the message being sent. Note: Setting the subject in the header takes precedence over this option.
subject.title: Subject

to.description: Sets the To email address. Separate multiple email addresses with comma.
to.title: To

javaMailSender.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.component.mail.JavaMailSender for sending emails.
javaMailSender.title: Java Mail Sender

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

additionalJavaMailProperties.description: Sets additional java mail properties, that will append/override any default properties that is set based on all the other options. This is useful if you need to add some special options but want to keep the others as is.
additionalJavaMailProperties.title: Additional Java Mail Properties

alternativeBodyHeader.description: Specifies the key to an IN message header that contains an alternative email body. For example, if you send emails in text/html format and want to provide an alternative mail body for non-HTML email clients, set the alternative mail body with this key as a header.
alternativeBodyHeader.title: Alternative Body Header

attachmentsContentTransferEncodingResolv.description: To use a custom AttachmentsContentTransferEncodingResolver to resolve what content-type-encoding to use for attachments.
attachmentsContentTransferEncodingResolv.title: Attachments Content Transfer Encoding Resolver

authenticator.description: The authenticator for login. If set then the password and username are ignored. Can be used for tokens which can expire and therefore must be read dynamically.
authenticator.title: Authenticator

binding.description: Sets the binding used to convert from a Camel message to and from a Mail message
binding.title: Binding

connectionTimeout.description: The connection timeout in milliseconds.
connectionTimeout.title: Connection Timeout

contentType.description: The mail message content type. Use text/html for HTML mails.
contentType.title: Content Type

contentTypeResolver.description: Resolver to determine Content-Type for file attachments.
contentTypeResolver.title: Content Type Resolver

debugMode.description: Enable debug mode on the underlying mail framework. The SUN Mail framework logs the debug messages to System.out by default.
debugMode.title: Debug Mode

headerFilterStrategy.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.spi.HeaderFilterStrategy to filter headers.
headerFilterStrategy.title: Header Filter Strategy

ignoreUnsupportedCharset.description: Option to let Camel ignore unsupported charset in the local JVM when sending mails. If the charset is unsupported then charset=XXX (where XXX represents the unsupported charset) is removed from the content-type and it relies on the platform default instead.
ignoreUnsupportedCharset.title: Ignore Unsupported Charset

ignoreUriScheme.description: Option to let Camel ignore unsupported charset in the local JVM when sending mails. If the charset is unsupported then charset=XXX (where XXX represents the unsupported charset) is removed from the content-type and it relies on the platform default instead.
ignoreUriScheme.title: Ignore Uri Scheme

javaMailProperties.description: Sets the java mail options. Will clear any default properties and only use the properties provided for this method.
javaMailProperties.title: Java Mail Properties

session.description: Specifies the mail session that camel should use for all mail interactions. Useful in scenarios where mail sessions are created and managed by some other resource, such as a JavaEE container. When using a custom mail session, then the hostname and port from the mail session will be used (if configured on the session).
session.title: Session

useInlineAttachments.description: Whether to use disposition inline or attachment.
useInlineAttachments.title: Use Inline Attachments

idempotentRepository.description: A pluggable repository org.apache.camel.spi.IdempotentRepository which allows to cluster consuming from the same mailbox, and let the repository coordinate whether a mail message is valid for the consumer to process. By default no repository is in use.
idempotentRepository.title: Idempotent Repository

idempotentRepositoryRemoveOnCommit.description: When using idempotent repository, then when the mail message has been successfully processed and is committed, should the message id be removed from the idempotent repository (default) or be kept in the repository. By default its assumed the message id is unique and has no value to be kept in the repository, because the mail message will be marked as seen/moved or deleted to prevent it from being consumed again. And therefore having the message id stored in the idempotent repository has little value. However this option allows to store the message id, for whatever reason you may have.
idempotentRepositoryRemoveOnCommit.title: Idempotent Repository Remove On Commit

searchTerm.description: Refers to a javax.mail.search.SearchTerm which allows to filter mails based on search criteria such as subject, body, from, sent after a certain date etc.
searchTerm.title: Search Term

moveTo.description: After processing a mail message, it can be moved to a mail folder with the given name. You can override this configuration value, with a header with the key moveTo, allowing you to move messages to folder names configured at runtime.
moveTo.title: Move To

peek.description: Will mark the javax.mail.Message as peeked before processing the mail message. This applies to IMAPMessage messages types only. By using peek the mail will not be eager marked as SEEN on the mail server, which allows us to rollback the mail message if there is an error processing in Camel.
peek.title: Peek

sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.
sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.title: Send Empty Message When Idle

skipFailedMessage.description: If the mail consumer cannot retrieve a given mail message, then this option allows to skip the message and move on to retrieve the next mail message. The default behavior would be the consumer throws an exception and no mails from the batch would be able to be routed by Camel.
skipFailedMessage.title: Skip Failed Message

unseen.description: Whether to limit by unseen mails only.
unseen.title: Unseen

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

failOnDuplicateFileAttachment.description: Whether to fail processing the mail if the mail message contains attachments with duplicate file names. If set to false, then the duplicate attachment is skipped and a WARN is logged. If set to true then an exception is thrown failing to process the mail message.
failOnDuplicateFileAttachment.title: Fail On Duplicate File Attachment

fetchSize.description: Sets the maximum number of messages to consume during a poll. This can be used to avoid overloading a mail server, if a mailbox folder contains a lot of messages. Default value of -1 means no fetch size and all messages will be consumed. Setting the value to 0 is a special corner case, where Camel will not consume any messages at all.
fetchSize.title: Fetch Size

generateMissingAttachmentNames.description: Set this to 'uuid' to set a UUID for the filename of the attachment if no filename was set
generateMissingAttachmentNames.title: Generate Missing Attachment Names

handleDuplicateAttachmentNames.description: Set the strategy to handle duplicate filenames of attachments never: attachments that have a filename which is already present in the attachments will be ignored unless failOnDuplicateFileAttachment is set to true. uuidPrefix: this will prefix the duplicate attachment filenames each with a uuid and underscore (uuid_filename.fileextension). uuidSuffix: this will suffix the duplicate attachment filenames each with a underscore and uuid (filename_uuid.fileextension).
handleDuplicateAttachmentNames.title: Handle Duplicate Attachment Names

mailUidGenerator.description: A pluggable MailUidGenerator that allows to use custom logic to generate UUID of the mail message.
mailUidGenerator.title: Mail Uid Generator

mapMailMessage.description: Specifies whether Camel should map the received mail message to Camel body/headers/attachments. If set to true, the body of the mail message is mapped to the body of the Camel IN message, the mail headers are mapped to IN headers, and the attachments to Camel IN attachment message. If this option is set to false then the IN message contains a raw javax.mail.Message. You can retrieve this raw message by calling exchange.getIn().getBody(javax.mail.Message.class).
mapMailMessage.title: Map Mail Message

pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.
pollStrategy.title: Poll Strategy

postProcessAction.description: Refers to an MailBoxPostProcessAction for doing post processing tasks on the mailbox once the normal processing ended.
postProcessAction.title: Post Process Action

bcc.description: Sets the BCC email address. Separate multiple email addresses with comma.
bcc.title: Bcc

cc.description: Sets the CC email address. Separate multiple email addresses with comma.
cc.title: Cc

replyTo.description: The Reply-To recipients (the receivers of the response mail). Separate multiple email addresses with a comma.
replyTo.title: Reply To

subject.description: The Subject of the message being sent. Note: Setting the subject in the header takes precedence over this option.
subject.title: Subject

to.description: Sets the To email address. Separate multiple email addresses with comma.
to.title: To

javaMailSender.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.component.mail.JavaMailSender for sending emails.
javaMailSender.title: Java Mail Sender

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

additionalJavaMailProperties.description: Sets additional java mail properties, that will append/override any default properties that is set based on all the other options. This is useful if you need to add some special options but want to keep the others as is.
additionalJavaMailProperties.title: Additional Java Mail Properties

alternativeBodyHeader.description: Specifies the key to an IN message header that contains an alternative email body. For example, if you send emails in text/html format and want to provide an alternative mail body for non-HTML email clients, set the alternative mail body with this key as a header.
alternativeBodyHeader.title: Alternative Body Header

attachmentsContentTransferEncodingResolv.description: To use a custom AttachmentsContentTransferEncodingResolver to resolve what content-type-encoding to use for attachments.
attachmentsContentTransferEncodingResolv.title: Attachments Content Transfer Encoding Resolver

authenticator.description: The authenticator for login. If set then the password and username are ignored. Can be used for tokens which can expire and therefore must be read dynamically.
authenticator.title: Authenticator

binding.description: Sets the binding used to convert from a Camel message to and from a Mail message
binding.title: Binding

connectionTimeout.description: The connection timeout in milliseconds.
connectionTimeout.title: Connection Timeout

contentType.description: The mail message content type. Use text/html for HTML mails.
contentType.title: Content Type

contentTypeResolver.description: Resolver to determine Content-Type for file attachments.
contentTypeResolver.title: Content Type Resolver

debugMode.description: Enable debug mode on the underlying mail framework. The SUN Mail framework logs the debug messages to System.out by default.
debugMode.title: Debug Mode

headerFilterStrategy.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.spi.HeaderFilterStrategy to filter headers.
headerFilterStrategy.title: Header Filter Strategy

ignoreUnsupportedCharset.description: Option to let Camel ignore unsupported charset in the local JVM when sending mails. If the charset is unsupported then charset=XXX (where XXX represents the unsupported charset) is removed from the content-type and it relies on the platform default instead.
ignoreUnsupportedCharset.title: Ignore Unsupported Charset

ignoreUriScheme.description: Option to let Camel ignore unsupported charset in the local JVM when sending mails. If the charset is unsupported then charset=XXX (where XXX represents the unsupported charset) is removed from the content-type and it relies on the platform default instead.
ignoreUriScheme.title: Ignore Uri Scheme

javaMailProperties.description: Sets the java mail options. Will clear any default properties and only use the properties provided for this method.
javaMailProperties.title: Java Mail Properties

session.description: Specifies the mail session that camel should use for all mail interactions. Useful in scenarios where mail sessions are created and managed by some other resource, such as a JavaEE container. When using a custom mail session, then the hostname and port from the mail session will be used (if configured on the session).
session.title: Session

useInlineAttachments.description: Whether to use disposition inline or attachment.
useInlineAttachments.title: Use Inline Attachments

idempotentRepository.description: A pluggable repository org.apache.camel.spi.IdempotentRepository which allows to cluster consuming from the same mailbox, and let the repository coordinate whether a mail message is valid for the consumer to process. By default no repository is in use.
idempotentRepository.title: Idempotent Repository

idempotentRepositoryRemoveOnCommit.description: When using idempotent repository, then when the mail message has been successfully processed and is committed, should the message id be removed from the idempotent repository (default) or be kept in the repository. By default its assumed the message id is unique and has no value to be kept in the repository, because the mail message will be marked as seen/moved or deleted to prevent it from being consumed again. And therefore having the message id stored in the idempotent repository has little value. However this option allows to store the message id, for whatever reason you may have.
idempotentRepositoryRemoveOnCommit.title: Idempotent Repository Remove On Commit

searchTerm.description: Refers to a javax.mail.search.SearchTerm which allows to filter mails based on search criteria such as subject, body, from, sent after a certain date etc.
searchTerm.title: Search Term

backoffErrorThreshold.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.
backoffErrorThreshold.title: Backoff Error Threshold

backoffIdleThreshold.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.
backoffIdleThreshold.title: Backoff Idle Threshold

backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.
backoffMultiplier.title: Backoff Multiplier

greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.
greedy.title: Greedy

initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.
initialDelay.title: Initial Delay

repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.
repeatCount.title: Repeat Count

runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.
runLoggingLevel.title: Run Logging Level

scheduledExecutorService.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.
scheduledExecutorService.title: Scheduled Executor Service

scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler
scheduler.title: Scheduler

schedulerProperties.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.
schedulerProperties.title: Scheduler Properties

startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.
startScheduler.title: Start Scheduler

timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.
timeUnit.title: Time Unit

useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.
useFixedDelay.title: Use Fixed Delay

password.description: The password for login. See also setAuthenticator(MailAuthenticator).
password.title: Password

username.description: The username for login. See also setAuthenticator(MailAuthenticator).
username.title: Username

sortTerm.description: Sorting order for messages. Only natively supported for IMAP. Emulated to some degree when using POP3 or when IMAP server does not have the SORT capability.
sortTerm.title: Sort Term

pubnub.title: PubNub
pubnub.description: Send and receive messages to/from PubNub data stream network for connected devices.

channel.description: The channel used for subscribing/publishing events
channel.title: Channel

uuid.description: UUID to be used as a device identifier, a default UUID is generated if not passed.
uuid.title: Uuid

withPresence.description: Also subscribe to related presence information
withPresence.title: With Presence

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

operation.description: The operation to perform. PUBLISH: Default. Send a message to all subscribers of a channel. FIRE: allows the client to send a message to BLOCKS Event Handlers. These messages will go directly to any Event Handlers registered on the channel. HERENOW: Obtain information about the current state of a channel including a list of unique user-ids currently subscribed to the channel and the total occupancy count. WHERENOW: Obtain information about the current list of channels to which a uuid is subscribed to. GETSTATE: Used to get key/value pairs specific to a subscriber uuid. State information is supplied as a JSON object of key/value pairs SETSTATE: Used to set key/value pairs specific to a subscriber uuid GETHISTORY: Fetches historical messages of a channel.
operation.title: Operation

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

pubnub.description: Reference to a Pubnub client in the registry.
pubnub.title: Pubnub

authKey.description: If Access Manager is utilized, client will use this authKey in all restricted requests.
authKey.title: Auth Key

cipherKey.description: If cipher is passed, all communications to/from PubNub will be encrypted.
cipherKey.title: Cipher Key

publishKey.description: The publish key obtained from your PubNub account. Required when publishing messages.
publishKey.title: Publish Key

secretKey.description: The secret key used for message signing.
secretKey.title: Secret Key

subscribeKey.description: The subscribe key obtained from your PubNub account. Required when subscribing to channels or listening for presence events
subscribeKey.title: Subscribe Key

pulsar.title: Pulsar
pulsar.description: Send and receive messages from/to Apache Pulsar messaging system.

persistence.description: Whether the topic is persistent or non-persistent
persistence.title: Persistence

authenticationClass.description: The Authentication FQCN to be used while creating the client from URI
authenticationClass.title: Authentication Class

authenticationParams.description: The Authentication Parameters to be used while creating the client from URI
authenticationParams.title: Authentication Params

serviceUrl.description: The Pulsar Service URL to point while creating the client from URI
serviceUrl.title: Service Url

ackGroupTimeMillis.description: Group the consumer acknowledgments for the specified time in milliseconds - defaults to 100
ackGroupTimeMillis.title: Ack Group Time Millis

ackTimeoutMillis.description: Timeout for unacknowledged messages in milliseconds - defaults to 10000
ackTimeoutMillis.title: Ack Timeout Millis

ackTimeoutRedeliveryBackoff.description: RedeliveryBackoff to use for ack timeout redelivery backoff.
ackTimeoutRedeliveryBackoff.title: Ack Timeout Redelivery Backoff

allowManualAcknowledgement.description: Whether to allow manual message acknowledgements. If this option is enabled, then messages are not acknowledged automatically after successful route completion. Instead, an instance of PulsarMessageReceipt is stored as a header on the org.apache.camel.Exchange. Messages can then be acknowledged using PulsarMessageReceipt at any time before the ackTimeout occurs.
allowManualAcknowledgement.title: Allow Manual Acknowledgement

consumerName.description: Name of the consumer when subscription is EXCLUSIVE
consumerName.title: Consumer Name

consumerNamePrefix.description: Prefix to add to consumer names when a SHARED or FAILOVER subscription is used
consumerNamePrefix.title: Consumer Name Prefix

consumerQueueSize.description: Size of the consumer queue - defaults to 10
consumerQueueSize.title: Consumer Queue Size

deadLetterTopic.description: Name of the topic where the messages which fail maxRedeliverCount times will be sent. Note: if not set, default topic name will be topicName-subscriptionName-DLQ
deadLetterTopic.title: Dead Letter Topic

maxRedeliverCount.description: Maximum number of times that a message will be redelivered before being sent to the dead letter queue. If this value is not set, no Dead Letter Policy will be created
maxRedeliverCount.title: Max Redeliver Count

messageListener.description: Whether to use the messageListener interface, or to receive messages using a separate thread pool
messageListener.title: Message Listener

negativeAckRedeliveryBackoff.description: RedeliveryBackoff to use for negative ack redelivery backoff.
negativeAckRedeliveryBackoff.title: Negative Ack Redelivery Backoff

numberOfConsumerThreads.description: Number of threads to receive and handle messages when using a separate thread pool
numberOfConsumerThreads.title: Number Of Consumer Threads

subscriptionInitialPosition.description: Control the initial position in the topic of a newly created subscription. Default is latest message.
subscriptionInitialPosition.title: Subscription Initial Position

subscriptionName.description: Name of the subscription to use
subscriptionName.title: Subscription Name

subscriptionTopicsMode.description: Determines to which topics this consumer should be subscribed to - Persistent, Non-Persistent, or both. Only used with pattern subscriptions.
subscriptionTopicsMode.title: Subscription Topics Mode

subscriptionType.description: Type of the subscription EXCLUSIVESHAREDFAILOVERKEY_SHARED, defaults to EXCLUSIVE
subscriptionType.title: Subscription Type

topicsPattern.description: Whether the topic is a pattern (regular expression) that allows the consumer to subscribe to all matching topics in the namespace
topicsPattern.title: Topics Pattern

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

batcherBuilder.description: Control batching method used by the producer.
batcherBuilder.title: Batcher Builder

batchingEnabled.description: Control whether automatic batching of messages is enabled for the producer.
batchingEnabled.title: Batching Enabled

batchingMaxMessages.description: The maximum size to batch messages.
batchingMaxMessages.title: Batching Max Messages

batchingMaxPublishDelayMicros.description: The maximum time period within which the messages sent will be batched if batchingEnabled is true.
batchingMaxPublishDelayMicros.title: Batching Max Publish Delay Micros

blockIfQueueFull.description: Whether to block the producing thread if pending messages queue is full or to throw a ProducerQueueIsFullError
blockIfQueueFull.title: Block If Queue Full

initialSequenceId.description: The first message published will have a sequence Id of initialSequenceId 1.
initialSequenceId.title: Initial Sequence Id

maxPendingMessages.description: Size of the pending massages queue. When the queue is full, by default, any further sends will fail unless blockIfQueueFull=true
maxPendingMessages.title: Max Pending Messages

maxPendingMessagesAcrossPartitions.description: The maximum number of pending messages for partitioned topics. The maxPendingMessages value will be reduced if (number of partitions maxPendingMessages) exceeds this value. Partitioned topics have a pending message queue for each partition.
maxPendingMessagesAcrossPartitions.title: Max Pending Messages Across Partitions

producerName.description: Name of the producer. If unset, lets Pulsar select a unique identifier.
producerName.title: Producer Name

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

quartz.title: Quartz
quartz.description: Schedule sending of messages using the Quartz 2.x scheduler.

groupName.description: The quartz group name to use. The combination of group name and trigger name should be unique.
groupName.title: Group Name

triggerName.description: The quartz trigger name to use. The combination of group name and trigger name should be unique.
triggerName.title: Trigger Name

cron.description: Specifies a cron expression to define when to trigger.
cron.title: Cron

deleteJob.description: If set to true, then the trigger automatically delete when route stop. Else if set to false, it will remain in scheduler. When set to false, it will also mean user may reuse pre-configured trigger with camel Uri. Just ensure the names match. Notice you cannot have both deleteJob and pauseJob set to true.
deleteJob.title: Delete Job

durableJob.description: Whether or not the job should remain stored after it is orphaned (no triggers point to it).
durableJob.title: Durable Job

pauseJob.description: If set to true, then the trigger automatically pauses when route stop. Else if set to false, it will remain in scheduler. When set to false, it will also mean user may reuse pre-configured trigger with camel Uri. Just ensure the names match. Notice you cannot have both deleteJob and pauseJob set to true.
pauseJob.title: Pause Job

recoverableJob.description: Instructs the scheduler whether or not the job should be re-executed if a 'recovery' or 'fail-over' situation is encountered.
recoverableJob.title: Recoverable Job

stateful.description: Uses a Quartz PersistJobDataAfterExecution and DisallowConcurrentExecution instead of the default job.
stateful.title: Stateful

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

customCalendar.description: Specifies a custom calendar to avoid specific range of date
customCalendar.title: Custom Calendar

ignoreExpiredNextFireTime.description: Whether to ignore quartz cannot schedule a trigger because the trigger will never fire in the future. This can happen when using a cron trigger that are configured to only run in the past. By default, Quartz will fail to schedule the trigger and therefore fail to start the Camel route. You can set this to true which then logs a WARN and then ignore the problem, meaning that the route will never fire in the future.
ignoreExpiredNextFireTime.title: Ignore Expired Next Fire Time

jobParameters.description: To configure additional options on the job.
jobParameters.title: Job Parameters

prefixJobNameWithEndpointId.description: Whether the job name should be prefixed with endpoint id
prefixJobNameWithEndpointId.title: Prefix Job Name With Endpoint Id

triggerParameters.description: To configure additional options on the trigger. The parameter timeZone is supported if the cron option is present. Otherwise the parameters repeatInterval and repeatCount are supported. Note: When using repeatInterval values of 1000 or less, the first few events after starting the camel context may be fired more rapidly than expected.
triggerParameters.title: Trigger Parameters

usingFixedCamelContextName.description: If it is true, JobDataMap uses the CamelContext name directly to reference the CamelContext, if it is false, JobDataMap uses use the CamelContext management name which could be changed during the deploy time.
usingFixedCamelContextName.title: Using Fixed Camel Context Name

autoStartScheduler.description: Whether or not the scheduler should be auto started.
autoStartScheduler.title: Auto Start Scheduler

triggerStartDelay.description: In case of scheduler has already started, we want the trigger start slightly after current time to ensure endpoint is fully started before the job kicks in. Negative value shifts trigger start time in the past.
triggerStartDelay.title: Trigger Start Delay

quickfix.title: QuickFix
quickfix.description: Open a Financial Interchange (FIX) session using an embedded QuickFix/J engine.

configurationName.description: Path to the quickfix configuration file. You can prefix with: classpath, file, http, ref, or bean. classpath, file and http loads the configuration file using these protocols (classpath is default). ref will lookup the configuration file in the registry. bean will call a method on a bean to be used as the configuration. For bean you can specify the method name after dot, eg bean:myBean.myMethod
configurationName.title: Configuration Name

lazyCreateEngine.description: This option allows creating QuickFIX/J engine on demand. Value true means the engine is started when first message is send or there's consumer configured in route definition. When false value is used, the engine is started at the endpoint creation. When this parameter is missing, the value of component's property lazyCreateEngines is being used.
lazyCreateEngine.title: Lazy Create Engine

sessionID.description: The optional sessionID identifies a specific FIX session. The format of the sessionID is: (BeginString):(SenderCompID)/(SenderSubID)/(SenderLocationID)-(TargetCompID)/(TargetSubID)/(TargetLocationID)
sessionID.title: Session ID

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

rabbitmq.title: RabbitMQ
rabbitmq.description: Send and receive messages from RabbitMQ instances.

exchangeName.description: The exchange name determines the exchange to which the produced messages will be sent to. In the case of consumers, the exchange name determines the exchange the queue will be bound to.
exchangeName.title: Exchange Name

addresses.description: If this option is set, camel-rabbitmq will try to create connection based on the setting of option addresses. The addresses value is a string which looks like server1:12345, server2:12345
addresses.title: Addresses

autoDelete.description: If it is true, the exchange will be deleted when it is no longer in use
autoDelete.title: Auto Delete

automaticRecoveryEnabled.description: Enables connection automatic recovery (uses connection implementation that performs automatic recovery when existing connection has failures)
automaticRecoveryEnabled.title: Automatic Recovery Enabled

connectionFactory.description: To use a custom RabbitMQ connection factory. When this option is set, all connection options (connectionTimeout, requestedChannelMax...) set on URI are not used
connectionFactory.title: Connection Factory

deadLetterExchange.description: The name of the dead letter exchange
deadLetterExchange.title: Dead Letter Exchange

deadLetterExchangeType.description: The type of the dead letter exchange
deadLetterExchangeType.title: Dead Letter Exchange Type

deadLetterQueue.description: The name of the dead letter queue
deadLetterQueue.title: Dead Letter Queue

deadLetterRoutingKey.description: The routing key for the dead letter exchange
deadLetterRoutingKey.title: Dead Letter Routing Key

declare.description: If the option is true, camel declare the exchange and queue name and bind them together. If the option is false, camel won't declare the exchange and queue name on the server.
declare.title: Declare

durable.description: If we are declaring a durable exchange (the exchange will survive a server restart)
durable.title: Durable

exchangeType.description: The exchange type such as direct or topic.
exchangeType.title: Exchange Type

exclusive.description: Exclusive queues may only be accessed by the current connection, and are deleted when that connection closes.
exclusive.title: Exclusive

hostname.description: The hostname of the running rabbitmq instance or cluster.
hostname.title: Hostname

passive.description: Passive queues depend on the queue already to be available at RabbitMQ.
passive.title: Passive

portNumber.description: Port number for the host with the running rabbitmq instance or cluster. Default value is 5672.
portNumber.title: Port Number

queue.description: The queue to receive messages from
queue.title: Queue

routingKey.description: The routing key to use when binding a consumer queue to the exchange. For producer routing keys, you set the header rabbitmq.ROUTING_KEY.
routingKey.title: Routing Key

skipDlqDeclare.description: If true the producer will not declare and bind a dead letter queue. This can be used if you have also DLQ rabbitmq consumer and you want to avoid argument clashing between Producer and Consumer. This option have no effect, if DLQ configured (deadLetterExchange option is not set).
skipDlqDeclare.title: Skip Dlq Declare

skipExchangeDeclare.description: This can be used if we need to declare the queue but not the exchange
skipExchangeDeclare.title: Skip Exchange Declare

skipQueueBind.description: If true the queue will not be bound to the exchange after declaring it
skipQueueBind.title: Skip Queue Bind

skipQueueDeclare.description: If true the producer will not declare and bind a queue. This can be used for directing messages via an existing routing key.
skipQueueDeclare.title: Skip Queue Declare

autoAck.description: If messages should be auto acknowledged
autoAck.title: Auto Ack

concurrentConsumers.description: Number of concurrent consumers when consuming from broker. (eg similar as to the same option for the JMS component).
concurrentConsumers.title: Concurrent Consumers

consumerTag.description: Specify a client-generated consumer tag to establish context when invoking the consume operation
consumerTag.title: Consumer Tag

exclusiveConsumer.description: Request exclusive access to the queue (meaning only this consumer can access the queue). This is useful when you want a long-lived shared queue to be temporarily accessible by just one consumer.
exclusiveConsumer.title: Exclusive Consumer

prefetchCount.description: The maximum number of messages that the server will deliver, 0 if unlimited. You need to specify the option of prefetchSize, prefetchCount, prefetchGlobal at the same time
prefetchCount.title: Prefetch Count

prefetchEnabled.description: Enables the quality of service on the RabbitMQConsumer side. You need to specify the option of prefetchSize, prefetchCount, prefetchGlobal at the same time
prefetchEnabled.title: Prefetch Enabled

prefetchGlobal.description: If the settings should be applied to the entire channel rather than each consumer You need to specify the option of prefetchSize, prefetchCount, prefetchGlobal at the same time
prefetchGlobal.title: Prefetch Global

prefetchSize.description: The maximum amount of content (measured in octets) that the server will deliver, 0 if unlimited. You need to specify the option of prefetchSize, prefetchCount, prefetchGlobal at the same time
prefetchSize.title: Prefetch Size

recoverFromDeclareException.description: Decides whether an exception during declaration of exchanges or queues is recoverable or not. If the option is false, camel will throw an exception when starting the consumer, which will interrupt application startup (e.g. in the case when the exchange / queue is already declared in RabbitMQ and has incompatible configuration). If set to true, the consumer will try to reconnect periodically.
recoverFromDeclareException.title: Recover From Declare Exception

reQueue.description: This is used by the consumer to control rejection of the message. When the consumer is complete processing the exchange, and if the exchange failed, then the consumer is going to reject the message from the RabbitMQ broker. If the header CamelRabbitmqRequeue is present then the value of the header will be used, otherwise this endpoint value is used as fallback. If the value is false (by default) then the message is discarded/dead-lettered. If the value is true, then the message is re-queued.
reQueue.title: Re Queue

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

threadPoolSize.description: The consumer uses a Thread Pool Executor with a fixed number of threads. This setting allows you to set that number of threads.
threadPoolSize.title: Thread Pool Size

additionalHeaders.description: Map of additional headers. These headers will be set only when the 'allowCustomHeaders' is set to true
additionalHeaders.title: Additional Headers

additionalProperties.description: Map of additional properties. These are standard RabbitMQ properties as defined in com.rabbitmq.client.AMQP.BasicProperties. The map keys should be from org.apache.camel.component.rabbitmq.RabbitMQConstants. Any other keys will be ignored.
additionalProperties.title: Additional Properties

allowCustomHeaders.description: Allow pass custom values to header
allowCustomHeaders.title: Allow Custom Headers

allowNullHeaders.description: Allow pass null values to header
allowNullHeaders.title: Allow Null Headers

bridgeEndpoint.description: If the bridgeEndpoint is true, the producer will ignore the message header of rabbitmq.EXCHANGE_NAME and rabbitmq.ROUTING_KEY
bridgeEndpoint.title: Bridge Endpoint

channelPoolMaxSize.description: Get maximum number of opened channel in pool
channelPoolMaxSize.title: Channel Pool Max Size

channelPoolMaxWait.description: Set the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for a channel from the pool
channelPoolMaxWait.title: Channel Pool Max Wait

guaranteedDeliveries.description: When true, an exception will be thrown when the message cannot be delivered (basic.return) and the message is marked as mandatory. PublisherAcknowledgement will also be activated in this case. See also publisher acknowledgements - When will messages be confirmed.
guaranteedDeliveries.title: Guaranteed Deliveries

immediate.description: This flag tells the server how to react if the message cannot be routed to a queue consumer immediately. If this flag is set, the server will return an undeliverable message with a Return method. If this flag is zero, the server will queue the message, but with no guarantee that it will ever be consumed. If the header is present rabbitmq.IMMEDIATE it will override this option.
immediate.title: Immediate

mandatory.description: This flag tells the server how to react if the message cannot be routed to a queue. If this flag is set, the server will return an unroutable message with a Return method. If this flag is zero, the server silently drops the message. If the header is present rabbitmq.MANDATORY it will override this option.
mandatory.title: Mandatory

publisherAcknowledgements.description: When true, the message will be published with publisher acknowledgements turned on
publisherAcknowledgements.title: Publisher Acknowledgements

publisherAcknowledgementsTimeout.description: The amount of time in milliseconds to wait for a basic.ack response from RabbitMQ server
publisherAcknowledgementsTimeout.title: Publisher Acknowledgements Timeout

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

allowMessageBodySerialization.description: Whether to allow Java serialization of the message body or not. If this value is true, the message body will be serialized on the producer side using Java serialization, if no type converter can handle the message body. On the consumer side, it will deserialize the message body if this value is true and the message contains a CamelSerialize header. Setting this value to true may introduce a security vulnerability as it allows an attacker to attempt to deserialize to a gadget object which could result in a RCE or other security vulnerability.
allowMessageBodySerialization.title: Allow Message Body Serialization

args.description: Specify arguments for configuring the different RabbitMQ concepts, a different prefix is required for each: Exchange: arg.exchange. Queue: arg.queue. Binding: arg.binding. DLQ: arg.dlq.queue. DLQ binding: arg.dlq.binding. For example to declare a queue with message ttl argument: http://localhost:5672/exchange/queueargs=arg.queue.x-message-ttl=60000
args.title: Args

clientProperties.description: Connection client properties (client info used in negotiating with the server)
clientProperties.title: Client Properties

connectionTimeout.description: Connection timeout
connectionTimeout.title: Connection Timeout

networkRecoveryInterval.description: Network recovery interval in milliseconds (interval used when recovering from network failure)
networkRecoveryInterval.title: Network Recovery Interval

requestedChannelMax.description: Connection requested channel max (max number of channels offered)
requestedChannelMax.title: Requested Channel Max

requestedFrameMax.description: Connection requested frame max (max size of frame offered)
requestedFrameMax.title: Requested Frame Max

requestedHeartbeat.description: Connection requested heartbeat (heart-beat in seconds offered)
requestedHeartbeat.title: Requested Heartbeat

requestTimeout.description: Set timeout for waiting for a reply when using the InOut Exchange Pattern (in milliseconds)
requestTimeout.title: Request Timeout

topologyRecoveryEnabled.description: Enables connection topology recovery (should topology recovery be performed)
topologyRecoveryEnabled.title: Topology Recovery Enabled

transferException.description: When true and an inOut Exchange failed on the consumer side send the caused Exception back in the response
transferException.title: Transfer Exception

sslProtocol.description: Enables SSL on connection, accepted value are true, TLS and 'SSLv3
sslProtocol.title: Ssl Protocol

trustManager.description: Configure SSL trust manager, SSL should be enabled for this option to be effective
trustManager.title: Trust Manager

username.description: Username in case of authenticated access
username.title: Username

reactive-streams.title: Reactive Streams
reactive-streams.description: Exchange messages with reactive stream processing libraries compatible with the reactive streams standard.

stream.description: Name of the stream channel used by the endpoint to exchange messages.
stream.title: Stream

concurrentConsumers.description: Number of threads used to process exchanges in the Camel route.
concurrentConsumers.title: Concurrent Consumers

exchangesRefillLowWatermark.description: Set the low watermark of requested exchanges to the active subscription as percentage of the maxInflightExchanges. When the number of pending items from the upstream source is lower than the watermark, new items can be requested to the subscription. If set to 0, the subscriber will request items in batches of maxInflightExchanges, only after all items of the previous batch have been processed. If set to 1, the subscriber can request a new item each time an exchange is processed (chatty). Any intermediate value can be used.
exchangesRefillLowWatermark.title: Exchanges Refill Low Watermark

forwardOnComplete.description: Determines if onComplete events should be pushed to the Camel route.
forwardOnComplete.title: Forward On Complete

forwardOnError.description: Determines if onError events should be pushed to the Camel route. Exceptions will be set as message body.
forwardOnError.title: Forward On Error

maxInflightExchanges.description: Maximum number of exchanges concurrently being processed by Camel. This parameter controls backpressure on the stream. Setting a non-positive value will disable backpressure.
maxInflightExchanges.title: Max Inflight Exchanges

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

backpressureStrategy.description: The backpressure strategy to use when pushing events to a slow subscriber.
backpressureStrategy.title: Backpressure Strategy

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

ref.title: Ref
ref.description: Route messages to an endpoint looked up dynamically by name in the Camel Registry.

name.description: Name of endpoint to lookup in the registry.
name.title: Name

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
