rest.title: REST
rest.description: Expose REST services or call external REST services.

consumes.description: Media type such as: 'text/xml', or 'application/json' this REST service accepts. By default we accept all kinds of types.
consumes.title: Consumes

inType.description: To declare the incoming POJO binding type as a FQN class name
inType.title: In Type

outType.description: To declare the outgoing POJO binding type as a FQN class name
outType.title: Out Type

produces.description: Media type such as: 'text/xml', or 'application/json' this REST service returns.
produces.title: Produces

routeId.description: Name of the route this REST services creates
routeId.title: Route Id

consumerComponentName.description: The Camel Rest component to use for the consumer REST transport, such as jetty, servlet, undertow. If no component has been explicitly configured, then Camel will lookup if there is a Camel component that integrates with the Rest DSL, or if a org.apache.camel.spi.RestConsumerFactory is registered in the registry. If either one is found, then that is being used.
consumerComponentName.title: Consumer Component Name

description.description: Human description to document this REST service
description.title: Description

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

apiDoc.description: The openapi api doc resource to use. The resource is loaded from classpath by default and must be in JSON format.
apiDoc.title: Api Doc

bindingMode.description: Configures the binding mode for the producer. If set to anything other than 'off' the producer will try to convert the body of the incoming message from inType to the json or xml, and the response from json or xml to outType.
bindingMode.title: Binding Mode

host.description: Host and port of HTTP service to use (override host in openapi schema)
host.title: Host

producerComponentName.description: The Camel Rest component to use for the producer REST transport, such as http, undertow. If no component has been explicitly configured, then Camel will lookup if there is a Camel component that integrates with the Rest DSL, or if a org.apache.camel.spi.RestProducerFactory is registered in the registry. If either one is found, then that is being used.
producerComponentName.title: Producer Component Name

queryParameters.description: Query parameters for the HTTP service to call. The query parameters can contain multiple parameters separated by ampersand such such as foo=123&bar=456.
queryParameters.title: Query Parameters

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

rest-api.title: REST API
rest-api.description: Expose OpenAPI Specification of the REST services defined using Camel REST DSL.

apiComponentName.description: The Camel Rest API component to use for generating the API of the REST services, such as openapi.
apiComponentName.title: Api Component Name

consumerComponentName.description: The Camel Rest component to use for the consumer REST transport, such as jetty, servlet, undertow. If no component has been explicitly configured, then Camel will lookup if there is a Camel component that integrates with the Rest DSL, or if a org.apache.camel.spi.RestConsumerFactory is registered in the registry. If either one is found, then that is being used.
consumerComponentName.title: Consumer Component Name

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

rest-openapi.title: REST OpenApi
rest-openapi.description: Configure REST producers based on an OpenAPI specification document delegating to a component implementing the RestProducerFactory interface.

specificationUri.description: Path to the OpenApi specification file. The scheme, host base path are taken from this specification, but these can be overridden with properties on the component or endpoint level. If not given the component tries to load openapi.json resource from the classpath. Note that the host defined on the component and endpoint of this Component should contain the scheme, hostname and optionally the port in the URI syntax (i.e. http://api.example.com:8080). Overrides component configuration. The OpenApi specification can be loaded from different sources by prefixing with file: classpath: http: https:. Support for https is limited to using the JDK installed UrlHandler, and as such it can be cumbersome to setup TLS/SSL certificates for https (such as setting a number of javax.net.ssl JVM system properties). How to do that consult the JDK documentation for UrlHandler. Default value notice: By default loads openapi.json file
specificationUri.title: Specification Uri

operationId.description: ID of the operation from the OpenApi specification.
operationId.title: Operation Id

basePath.description: API basePath, for example /v2. Default is unset, if set overrides the value present in OpenApi specification and in the component configuration.
basePath.title: Base Path

componentName.description: Name of the Camel component that will perform the requests. The component must be present in Camel registry and it must implement RestProducerFactory service provider interface. If not set CLASSPATH is searched for single component that implements RestProducerFactory SPI. Overrides component configuration.
componentName.title: Component Name

consumes.description: What payload type this component capable of consuming. Could be one type, like application/json or multiple types as application/json, application/xml; q=0.5 according to the RFC7231. This equates to the value of Accept HTTP header. If set overrides any value found in the OpenApi specification and. in the component configuration
consumes.title: Consumes

host.description: Scheme hostname and port to direct the HTTP requests to in the form of https://hostname:port. Can be configured at the endpoint, component or in the corresponding REST configuration in the Camel Context. If you give this component a name (e.g. petstore) that REST configuration is consulted first, rest-openapi next, and global configuration last. If set overrides any value found in the OpenApi specification, RestConfiguration. Overrides all other configuration.
host.title: Host

produces.description: What payload type this component is producing. For example application/json according to the RFC7231. This equates to the value of Content-Type HTTP header. If set overrides any value present in the OpenApi specification. Overrides all other configuration.
produces.title: Produces

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

rest-swagger.title: REST Swagger
rest-swagger.description: Configure REST producers based on a Swagger (OpenAPI) specification document delegating to a component implementing the RestProducerFactory interface.

specificationUri.description: Path to the Swagger specification file. The scheme, host base path are taken from this specification, but these can be overridden with properties on the component or endpoint level. If not given the component tries to load swagger.json resource from the classpath. Note that the host defined on the component and endpoint of this Component should contain the scheme, hostname and optionally the port in the URI syntax (i.e. http://api.example.com:8080). Overrides component configuration. The Swagger specification can be loaded from different sources by prefixing with file: classpath: http: https:. Support for https is limited to using the JDK installed UrlHandler, and as such it can be cumbersome to setup TLS/SSL certificates for https (such as setting a number of javax.net.ssl JVM system properties). How to do that consult the JDK documentation for UrlHandler. Default value notice: By default loads swagger.json file
specificationUri.title: Specification Uri

operationId.description: ID of the operation from the Swagger specification.
operationId.title: Operation Id

basePath.description: API basePath, for example /v2. Default is unset, if set overrides the value present in Swagger specification and in the component configuration.
basePath.title: Base Path

componentName.description: Name of the Camel component that will perform the requests. The component must be present in Camel registry and it must implement RestProducerFactory service provider interface. If not set CLASSPATH is searched for single component that implements RestProducerFactory SPI. Overrides component configuration.
componentName.title: Component Name

consumes.description: What payload type this component capable of consuming. Could be one type, like application/json or multiple types as application/json, application/xml; q=0.5 according to the RFC7231. This equates to the value of Accept HTTP header. If set overrides any value found in the Swagger specification and. in the component configuration
consumes.title: Consumes

host.description: Scheme hostname and port to direct the HTTP requests to in the form of https://hostname:port. Can be configured at the endpoint, component or in the corresponding REST configuration in the Camel Context. If you give this component a name (e.g. petstore) that REST configuration is consulted first, rest-swagger next, and global configuration last. If set overrides any value found in the Swagger specification, RestConfiguration. Overrides all other configuration.
host.title: Host

produces.description: What payload type this component is producing. For example application/json according to the RFC7231. This equates to the value of Content-Type HTTP header. If set overrides any value present in the Swagger specification. Overrides all other configuration.
produces.title: Produces

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

resteasy.title: Resteasy
resteasy.description: Expose REST endpoints and access external REST servers.

httpUri.description: The url of the HTTP endpoint to call.
httpUri.title: Http Uri

disableStreamCache.description: Determines whether or not the raw input stream from Servlet is cached or not (Camel will read the stream into a in memory/overflow to file, Stream caching) cache. By default Camel will cache the Servlet input stream to support reading it multiple times to ensure it Camel can retrieve all data from the stream. However you can set this option to true when you for example need to access the raw stream, such as streaming it directly to a file or other persistent store. DefaultHttpBinding will copy the request input stream into a stream cache and put it into message body if this option is false to support reading the stream multiple times. If you use Servlet to bridge/proxy an endpoint then consider enabling this option to improve performance, in case you do not need to read the message payload multiple times. The http producer will by default cache the response body stream. If setting this option to true, then the producers will not cache the response body stream but use the response stream as-is as the message body.
disableStreamCache.title: Disable Stream Cache

resteasyMethod.description: Sets the resteasy method to process the request
resteasyMethod.title: Resteasy Method

async.description: Configure the consumer to work in async mode
async.title: Async

httpMethodRestrict.description: Used to only allow consuming if the HttpMethod matches, such as GET/POST/PUT etc. Multiple methods can be specified separated by comma.
httpMethodRestrict.title: Http Method Restrict

muteException.description: If enabled and an Exchange failed processing on the consumer side the response's body won't contain the exception's stack trace.
muteException.title: Mute Exception

responseBufferSize.description: To use a custom buffer size on the javax.servlet.ServletResponse.
responseBufferSize.title: Response Buffer Size

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

eagerCheckContentAvailable.description: Whether to eager check whether the HTTP requests has content if the content-length header is 0 or not present. This can be turned on in case HTTP clients do not send streamed data.
eagerCheckContentAvailable.title: Eager Check Content Available

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

mapHttpMessageBody.description: If this option is true then IN exchange Body of the exchange will be mapped to HTTP body. Setting this to false will avoid the HTTP mapping.
mapHttpMessageBody.title: Map Http Message Body

mapHttpMessageFormUrlEncodedBody.description: If this option is true then IN exchange Form Encoded body of the exchange will be mapped to HTTP. Setting this to false will avoid the HTTP Form Encoded body mapping.
mapHttpMessageFormUrlEncodedBody.title: Map Http Message Form Url Encoded Body

mapHttpMessageHeaders.description: If this option is true then IN exchange Headers of the exchange will be mapped to HTTP headers. Setting this to false will avoid the HTTP Headers mapping.
mapHttpMessageHeaders.title: Map Http Message Headers

optionsEnabled.description: Specifies whether to enable HTTP OPTIONS for this Servlet consumer. By default OPTIONS is turned off.
optionsEnabled.title: Options Enabled

traceEnabled.description: Specifies whether to enable HTTP TRACE for this Servlet consumer. By default TRACE is turned off.
traceEnabled.title: Trace Enabled

bridgeEndpoint.description: If the option is true, HttpProducer will ignore the Exchange.HTTP_URI header, and use the endpoint's URI for request. You may also set the option throwExceptionOnFailure to be false to let the HttpProducer send all the fault response back.
bridgeEndpoint.title: Bridge Endpoint

clearExpiredCookies.description: Whether to clear expired cookies before sending the HTTP request. This ensures the cookies store does not keep growing by adding new cookies which is newer removed when they are expired. If the component has disabled cookie management then this option is disabled too.
clearExpiredCookies.title: Clear Expired Cookies

connectionClose.description: Specifies whether a Connection Close header must be added to HTTP Request. By default connectionClose is false.
connectionClose.title: Connection Close

copyHeaders.description: If this option is true then IN exchange headers will be copied to OUT exchange headers according to copy strategy. Setting this to false, allows to only include the headers from the HTTP response (not propagating IN headers).
copyHeaders.title: Copy Headers

customHostHeader.description: To use custom host header for producer. When not set in query will be ignored. When set will override host header derived from url.
customHostHeader.title: Custom Host Header

httpMethod.description: Configure the HTTP method to use. The HttpMethod header cannot override this option if set.
httpMethod.title: Http Method

ignoreResponseBody.description: If this option is true, The http producer won't read response body and cache the input stream
ignoreResponseBody.title: Ignore Response Body

preserveHostHeader.description: If the option is true, HttpProducer will set the Host header to the value contained in the current exchange Host header, useful in reverse proxy applications where you want the Host header received by the downstream server to reflect the URL called by the upstream client, this allows applications which use the Host header to generate accurate URL's for a proxied service
preserveHostHeader.title: Preserve Host Header

throwExceptionOnFailure.description: Option to disable throwing the HttpOperationFailedException in case of failed responses from the remote server. This allows you to get all responses regardless of the HTTP status code.
throwExceptionOnFailure.title: Throw Exception On Failure

cookieHandler.description: Configure a cookie handler to maintain a HTTP session
cookieHandler.title: Cookie Handler

deleteWithBody.description: Whether the HTTP DELETE should include the message body or not. By default HTTP DELETE do not include any HTTP body. However in some rare cases users may need to be able to include the message body.
deleteWithBody.title: Delete With Body

followRedirects.description: Whether to the HTTP request should follow redirects. By default the HTTP request does not follow redirects
followRedirects.title: Follow Redirects

getWithBody.description: Whether the HTTP GET should include the message body or not. By default HTTP GET do not include any HTTP body. However in some rare cases users may need to be able to include the message body.
getWithBody.title: Get With Body

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

okStatusCodeRange.description: The status codes which are considered a success response. The values are inclusive. Multiple ranges can be defined, separated by comma, e.g. 200-204,209,301-304. Each range must be a single number or from-to with the dash included.
okStatusCodeRange.title: Ok Status Code Range

skipRequestHeaders.description: Whether to skip mapping all the Camel headers as HTTP request headers. If there are no data from Camel headers needed to be included in the HTTP request then this can avoid parsing overhead with many object allocations for the JVM garbage collector.
skipRequestHeaders.title: Skip Request Headers

skipResponseHeaders.description: Whether to skip mapping all the HTTP response headers to Camel headers. If there are no data needed from HTTP headers then this can avoid parsing overhead with many object allocations for the JVM garbage collector.
skipResponseHeaders.title: Skip Response Headers

userAgent.description: To set a custom HTTP User-Agent request header
userAgent.title: User Agent

headerFilterStrategy.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.
headerFilterStrategy.title: Header Filter Strategy

setHttpResponseDuringProcessing.description: Sets the flag to use the endpoint where you can either populate camel exchange from servlet response or use request itself which may be thought as if it is a proxy.
setHttpResponseDuringProcessing.title: Set Http Response During Processing

skipServletProcessing.description: Sets the flag to use skip servlet processing and let camel take over processing
skipServletProcessing.title: Skip Servlet Processing

useSystemProperties.description: To use System Properties as fallback for configuration
useSystemProperties.title: Use System Properties

robotframework.title: Robot Framework
robotframework.description: Pass camel exchanges to acceptence test written in Robot DSL.

resourceUri.description: Path to the resource. You can prefix with: classpath, file, http, ref, or bean. classpath, file and http loads the resource using these protocols (classpath is default). ref will lookup the resource in the registry. bean will call a method on a bean to be used as the resource. For bean you can specify the method name after dot, eg bean:myBean.myMethod.
resourceUri.title: Resource Uri

allowContextMapAll.description: Sets whether the context map should allow access to all details. By default only the message body and headers can be accessed. This option can be enabled for full access to the current Exchange and CamelContext. Doing so impose a potential security risk as this opens access to the full power of CamelContext API.
allowContextMapAll.title: Allow Context Map All

allowTemplateFromHeader.description: Whether to allow to use resource template from header or not (default false). Enabling this allows to specify dynamic templates via message header. However this can be seen as a potential security vulnerability if the header is coming from a malicious user, so use this with care.
allowTemplateFromHeader.title: Allow Template From Header

argumentFile.description: A text file to read more arguments from.
argumentFile.title: Argument File

combinedTagStats.description: Creates combined statistics based on tags. Use the format tags:title List
combinedTagStats.title: Combined Tag Stats

contentCache.description: Sets whether to use resource content cache or not
contentCache.title: Content Cache

criticalTags.description: Tests that have the given tags are considered critical. List
criticalTags.title: Critical Tags

debugFile.description: A debug file that is written during execution.
debugFile.title: Debug File

document.description: Sets the documentation of the top-level tests suites.
document.title: Document

dryrun.description: Sets dryrun mode on use. In the dry run mode tests are run without executing keywords originating from test libraries. Useful for validating test data syntax.
dryrun.title: Dryrun

excludes.description: Selects the tests cases by tags. List
excludes.title: Excludes

exitOnFailure.description: Sets robot to stop execution immediately if a critical test fails.
exitOnFailure.title: Exit On Failure

includes.description: Selects the tests cases by tags. List
includes.title: Includes

listener.description: Sets a single listener for monitoring tests execution
listener.title: Listener

listeners.description: Sets multiple listeners for monitoring tests execution. Use the format ListenerWithArgs:arg1:arg2 or simply ListenerWithoutArgs List
listeners.title: Listeners

log.description: Sets the path to the generated log file.
log.title: Log

logLevel.description: Sets the threshold level for logging.
logLevel.title: Log Level

logTitle.description: Sets a title for the generated tests log.
logTitle.title: Log Title

metadata.description: Sets free metadata for the top level tests suites. comma seperated list of string resulting as List
metadata.title: Metadata

monitorColors.description: Using ANSI colors in console. Normally colors work in unixes but not in Windows. Default is 'on'. 'on' - use colors in unixes but not in Windows 'off' - never use colors 'force' - always use colors (also in Windows)
monitorColors.title: Monitor Colors

monitorWidth.description: Width of the monitor output. Default is 78.
monitorWidth.title: Monitor Width

name.description: Sets the name of the top-level tests suites.
name.title: Name

nonCriticalTags.description: Tests that have the given tags are not critical. List
nonCriticalTags.title: Non Critical Tags

noStatusReturnCode.description: If true, sets the return code to zero regardless of failures in test cases. Error codes are returned normally.
noStatusReturnCode.title: No Status Return Code

output.description: Sets the path to the generated output file.
output.title: Output

outputDirectory.description: Configures where generated reports are to be placed.
outputDirectory.title: Output Directory

randomize.description: Sets the test execution order to be randomized. Valid values are all, suite, and test
randomize.title: Randomize

report.description: Sets the path to the generated report file.
report.title: Report

reportBackground.description: Sets background colors for the generated report and summary.
reportBackground.title: Report Background

reportTitle.description: Sets a title for the generated tests report.
reportTitle.title: Report Title

runEmptySuite.description: Executes tests also if the top level test suite is empty. Useful e.g. with --include/--exclude when it is not an error that no test matches the condition.
runEmptySuite.title: Run Empty Suite

runFailed.description: Re-run failed tests, based on output.xml file.
runFailed.title: Run Failed

runMode.description: Sets the execution mode for this tests run. Note that this setting has been deprecated in Robot Framework 2.8. Use separate dryryn, skipTeardownOnExit, exitOnFailure, and randomize settings instead.
runMode.title: Run Mode

skipTeardownOnExit.description: Sets whether the teardowns are skipped if the test execution is prematurely stopped.
skipTeardownOnExit.title: Skip Teardown On Exit

suites.description: Selects the tests suites by name. List
suites.title: Suites

suiteStatLevel.description: Defines how many levels to show in the Statistics by Suite table in outputs.
suiteStatLevel.title: Suite Stat Level

summaryTitle.description: Sets a title for the generated summary report.
summaryTitle.title: Summary Title

tagDocs.description: Adds documentation to the specified tags. List
tagDocs.title: Tag Docs

tags.description: Sets the tags(s) to all executed tests cases. List
tags.title: Tags

tagStatExcludes.description: Excludes these tags from the Statistics by Tag and Test Details by Tag tables in outputs. List
tagStatExcludes.title: Tag Stat Excludes

tagStatIncludes.description: Includes only these tags in the Statistics by Tag and Test Details by Tag tables in outputs. List
tagStatIncludes.title: Tag Stat Includes

tagStatLinks.description: Adds external links to the Statistics by Tag table in outputs. Use the format pattern:link:title List
tagStatLinks.title: Tag Stat Links

tests.description: Selects the tests cases by name. List
tests.title: Tests

timestampOutputs.description: Adds a timestamp to all output files.
timestampOutputs.title: Timestamp Outputs

variableFiles.description: Sets variables using variables files. Use the format path:args List
variableFiles.title: Variable Files

variables.description: Sets individual variables. Use the format name:value List
variables.title: Variables

warnOnSkippedFiles.description: Show a warning when an invalid file is skipped.
warnOnSkippedFiles.title: Warn On Skipped Files

xunitFile.description: Sets the path to the generated XUnit compatible result file, relative to outputDirectory. The file is in xml format. By default, the file name is derived from the testCasesDirectory parameter, replacing blanks in the directory name by underscores.
xunitFile.title: Xunit File

sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.
sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.title: Send Empty Message When Idle

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.
pollStrategy.title: Poll Strategy

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

backoffErrorThreshold.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.
backoffErrorThreshold.title: Backoff Error Threshold

backoffIdleThreshold.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.
backoffIdleThreshold.title: Backoff Idle Threshold

backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.
backoffMultiplier.title: Backoff Multiplier

greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.
greedy.title: Greedy

initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.
initialDelay.title: Initial Delay

repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.
repeatCount.title: Repeat Count

runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.
runLoggingLevel.title: Run Logging Level

scheduledExecutorService.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.
scheduledExecutorService.title: Scheduled Executor Service

scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler
scheduler.title: Scheduler

schedulerProperties.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.
schedulerProperties.title: Scheduler Properties

startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.
startScheduler.title: Start Scheduler

timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.
timeUnit.title: Time Unit

useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.
useFixedDelay.title: Use Fixed Delay

rocketmq.title: RocketMQ
rocketmq.description: Send and receive messages from RocketMQ cluster.

namesrvAddr.description: Name server address of RocketMQ cluster.
namesrvAddr.title: Namesrv Addr

subscribeTags.description: Subscribe tags of consumer. Multiple tags could be split by , such as TagATagB
subscribeTags.title: Subscribe Tags

By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

replyToConsumerGroup.description: Consumer group name used for receiving response.
replyToConsumerGroup.title: Reply To Consumer Group

replyToTopic.description: Topic used for receiving response when using in-out pattern.
replyToTopic.title: Reply To Topic

sendTag.description: Each message would be sent with this tag.
sendTag.title: Send Tag

waitForSendResult.description: Whether waiting for send result before routing to next endpoint.
waitForSendResult.title: Wait For Send Result

By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

requestTimeoutCheckerIntervalMillis.description: Check interval milliseconds of request timeout.
requestTimeoutCheckerIntervalMillis.title: Request Timeout Checker Interval Millis

requestTimeoutMillis.description: Timeout milliseconds of receiving response when using in-out pattern.
requestTimeoutMillis.title: Request Timeout Millis

feedUri.description: The URI to the feed to poll.
feedUri.title: Feed Uri

feedHeader.description: Sets whether to add the feed object as a header.
feedHeader.title: Feed Header

password.description: Sets the password to be used for basic authentication when polling from a HTTP feed.
password.title: Password

sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.
sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.title: Send Empty Message When Idle

sortEntries.description: Sets whether to sort entries by published date. Only works when splitEntries = true.
sortEntries.title: Sort Entries

splitEntries.description: Sets whether or not entries should be sent individually or whether the entire feed should be sent as a single message
splitEntries.title: Split Entries

throttleEntries.description: Sets whether all entries identified in a single feed poll should be delivered immediately. If true, only one entry is processed per delay. Only applicable when splitEntries = true.
throttleEntries.title: Throttle Entries

username.description: Sets the username to be used for basic authentication when polling from a HTTP feed.
username.title: Username

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. salesforce.title: Salesforce
salesforce.description: Communicate with Salesforce using Java DTOs.

topicName.description: The name of the topic/channel to use
topicName.title: Topic Name

apiVersion.description: Salesforce API version.
apiVersion.title: Api Version

backoffIncrement.description: Backoff interval increment for Streaming connection restart attempts for failures beyond CometD auto-reconnect.
backoffIncrement.title: Backoff Increment

contentType.description: Bulk API content type, one of XML, CSV, ZIP_XML, ZIP_CSV
contentType.title: Content Type

defaultReplayId.description: Default replayId setting if no value is found in initialReplayIdMap
defaultReplayId.title: Default Replay Id

fallBackReplayId.description: ReplayId to fall back to after an Invalid Replay Id response
fallBackReplayId.title: Fall Back Replay Id

format.description: Payload format to use for Salesforce API calls, either JSON or XML, defaults to JSON. As of Camel 3.12, this option only applies to the Raw operation.
format.title: Format

httpClient.description: Custom Jetty Http Client to use to connect to Salesforce.
httpClient.title: Http Client

includeDetails.description: Include details in Salesforce1 Analytics report, defaults to false.
includeDetails.title: Include Details

initialReplayIdMap.description: Replay IDs to start from per channel name.
initialReplayIdMap.title: Initial Replay Id Map

instanceId.description: Salesforce1 Analytics report execution instance ID
instanceId.title: Instance Id

limit.description: Limit on number of returned records. Applicable to some of the API, check the Salesforce documentation.
limit.title: Limit

locator.description: Locator provided by salesforce Bulk 2.0 API for use in getting results for a Query job.
locator.title: Locator

maxBackoff.description: Maximum backoff interval for Streaming connection restart attempts for failures beyond CometD auto-reconnect.
maxBackoff.title: Max Backoff

maxRecords.description: The maximum number of records to retrieve per set of results for a Bulk 2.0 Query. The request is still subject to the size limits. If you are working with a very large number of query results, you may experience a timeout before receiving all the data from Salesforce. To prevent a timeout, specify the maximum number of records your client is expecting to receive in the maxRecords parameter. This splits the results into smaller sets with this value as the maximum size.
maxRecords.title: Max Records

notFoundBehaviour.description: Sets the behaviour of 404 not found status received from Salesforce API. Should the body be set to NULL NotFoundBehaviour#NULL or should a exception be signaled on the exchange NotFoundBehaviour#EXCEPTION - the default.
notFoundBehaviour.title: Not Found Behaviour

notifyForFields.description: Notify for fields, options are ALL, REFERENCED, SELECT, WHERE
notifyForFields.title: Notify For Fields

notifyForOperationCreate.description: Notify for create operation, defaults to false (API version >= 29.0)
notifyForOperationCreate.title: Notify For Operation Create

notifyForOperationDelete.description: Notify for delete operation, defaults to false (API version >= 29.0)
notifyForOperationDelete.title: Notify For Operation Delete

notifyForOperations.description: Notify for operations, options are ALL, CREATE, EXTENDED, UPDATE (API version < 29.0)
notifyForOperations.title: Notify For Operations

notifyForOperationUndelete.description: Notify for un-delete operation, defaults to false (API version >= 29.0)
notifyForOperationUndelete.title: Notify For Operation Undelete

notifyForOperationUpdate.description: Notify for update operation, defaults to false (API version >= 29.0)
notifyForOperationUpdate.title: Notify For Operation Update

objectMapper.description: Custom Jackson ObjectMapper to use when serializing/deserializing Salesforce objects.
objectMapper.title: Object Mapper

pkChunking.description: Use PK Chunking. Only for use in original Bulk API. Bulk 2.0 API performs PK chunking automatically, if necessary.
pkChunking.title: Pk Chunking

pkChunkingChunkSize.description: Chunk size for use with PK Chunking. If unspecified, salesforce default is 100,000. Maximum size is 250,000.
pkChunkingChunkSize.title: Pk Chunking Chunk Size

pkChunkingParent.description: Specifies the parent object when you're enabling PK chunking for queries on sharing objects. The chunks are based on the parent object's records rather than the sharing object's records. For example, when querying on AccountShare, specify Account as the parent object. PK chunking is supported for sharing objects as long as the parent object is supported.
pkChunkingParent.title: Pk Chunking Parent

pkChunkingStartRow.description: Specifies the 15-character or 18-character record ID to be used as the lower boundary for the first chunk. Use this parameter to specify a starting ID when restarting a job that failed between batches.
pkChunkingStartRow.title: Pk Chunking Start Row

queryLocator.description: Query Locator provided by salesforce for use when a query results in more records than can be retrieved in a single call. Use this value in a subsequent call to retrieve additional records.
queryLocator.title: Query Locator

rawPayload.description: Use raw payload String for request and response (either JSON or XML depending on format), instead of DTOs, false by default
rawPayload.title: Raw Payload

reportMetadata.description: Salesforce1 Analytics report metadata for filtering
reportMetadata.title: Report Metadata

sObjectClass.description: Fully qualified SObject class name, usually generated using camel-salesforce-maven-plugin
sObjectClass.title: SObject Class

sObjectId.description: SObject ID if required by API
sObjectId.title: SObject Id

sObjectName.description: SObject name if required or supported by API
sObjectName.title: SObject Name

streamQueryResult.description: If true, streams SOQL query result and transparently handles subsequent requests if there are multiple pages. Otherwise, results are returned one page at a time.
streamQueryResult.title: Stream query result

updateTopic.description: Whether to update an existing Push Topic when using the Streaming API, defaults to false
updateTopic.title: Update Topic

replayId.description: The replayId value to use when subscribing
replayId.title: Replay Id

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

allOrNone.description: Composite API option to indicate to rollback all records if any are not successful.
allOrNone.title: All Or None

rawHttpHeaders.description: Comma separated list of message headers to include as HTTP parameters for Raw operation.
rawHttpHeaders.title: Raw Http Headers

rawMethod.description: HTTP method to use for the Raw operation
rawMethod.title: Raw Method

rawPath.description: The portion of the endpoint URL after the domain name. E.g., '/services/data/v52.0/sobjects/Account/'
rawPath.title: Raw Path

rawQueryParameters.description: Comma separated list of message headers to include as query parameters for Raw operation. Do not url-encode values as this will be done automatically.
rawQueryParameters.title: Raw Query Parameters

pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.
pollStrategy.title: Poll Strategy

synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used
synchronous.title: Synchronous

backoffErrorThreshold.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.
backoffErrorThreshold.title: Backoff Error Threshold

backoffIdleThreshold.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.
backoffIdleThreshold.title: Backoff Idle Threshold

backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.
backoffMultiplier.title: Backoff Multiplier

greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.
greedy.title: Greedy

initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.
initialDelay.title: Initial Delay

poolSize.description: Number of core threads in the thread pool used by the scheduling thread pool. Is by default using a single thread
poolSize.title: Pool Size

repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.
repeatCount.title: Repeat Count

runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.
runLoggingLevel.title: Run Logging Level

scheduledExecutorService.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.
scheduledExecutorService.title: Scheduled Executor Service

scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler
scheduler.title: Scheduler

schedulerProperties.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.
schedulerProperties.title: Scheduler Properties

startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.
startScheduler.title: Start Scheduler

timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.
timeUnit.title: Time Unit

useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.
useFixedDelay.title: Use Fixed Delay

schematron.title: Schematron
schematron.description: Validate XML payload using the Schematron Library.

path.description: The path to the schematron rules file. Can either be in class path or location in the file system.
path.title: Path

abort.description: Flag to abort the route and throw a schematron validation exception.
abort.title: Abort

rules.description: To use the given schematron rules instead of loading from the path
rules.title: Rules

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

uriResolver.description: Set the URIResolver to be used for resolving schematron includes in the rules file.
uriResolver.title: Uri Resolver

scp.title: SCP
scp.description: Copy files to/from remote hosts using the secure copy protocol (SCP).

port.description: Port of the FTP server
port.title: Port

chmod.description: Allows you to set chmod on the stored file. For example chmod=664.
chmod.title: Chmod

disconnect.description: Whether or not to disconnect from remote FTP server right after use. Disconnect will only disconnect the current connection to the FTP server. If you have a consumer which you want to stop, then you need to stop the consumer/route instead.
disconnect.title: Disconnect

fileName.description: Use Expression such as File Language to dynamically set the filename. For consumers, it's used as a filename filter. For producers, it's used to evaluate the filename to write. If an expression is set, it take precedence over the CamelFileName header. (Note: The header itself can also be an Expression). The expression options support both String and Expression types. If the expression is a String type, it is always evaluated using the File Language. If the expression is an Expression type, the specified Expression type is used - this allows you, for instance, to use OGNL expressions. For the consumer, you can use it to filter filenames, so you can for instance consume today's file using the File Language syntax: mydata-${date:now:yyyyMMdd}.txt. The producers support the CamelOverruleFileName header which takes precedence over any existing CamelFileName header; the CamelOverruleFileName is a header that is used only once, and makes it easier as this avoids to temporary store CamelFileName and have to restore it afterwards.
fileName.title: File Name

flatten.description: Flatten is used to flatten the file name path to strip any leading paths, so it's just the file name. This allows you to consume recursively into sub-directories, but when you eg write the files to another directory they will be written in a single directory. Setting this to true on the producer enforces that any file name in CamelFileName header will be stripped for any leading paths.
flatten.title: Flatten

jailStartingDirectory.description: Used for jailing (restricting) writing files to the starting directory (and sub) only. This is enabled by default to not allow Camel to write files to outside directories (to be more secured out of the box). You can turn this off to allow writing files to directories outside the starting directory, such as parent or root folders.
jailStartingDirectory.title: Jail Starting Directory

strictHostKeyChecking.description: Sets whether to use strict host key checking. Possible values are: no, yes
strictHostKeyChecking.title: Strict Host Key Checking

allowNullBody.description: Used to specify if a null body is allowed during file writing. If set to true then an empty file will be created, when set to false, and attempting to send a null body to the file component, a GenericFileWriteException of 'Cannot write null body to file.' will be thrown. If the fileExist option is set to 'Override', then the file will be truncated, and if set to append the file will remain unchanged.
allowNullBody.title: Allow Null Body

disconnectOnBatchComplete.description: Whether or not to disconnect from remote FTP server right after a Batch upload is complete. disconnectOnBatchComplete will only disconnect the current connection to the FTP server.
disconnectOnBatchComplete.title: Disconnect On Batch Complete

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

moveExistingFileStrategy.description: Strategy (Custom Strategy) used to move file with special naming token to use when fileExist=Move is configured. By default, there is an implementation used if no custom strategy is provided
moveExistingFileStrategy.title: Move Existing File Strategy

connectTimeout.description: Sets the connect timeout for waiting for a connection to be established Used by both FTPClient and JSCH
connectTimeout.title: Connect Timeout

soTimeout.description: Sets the so timeout FTP and FTPS Is the SocketOptions.SO_TIMEOUT value in millis. Recommended option is to set this to 300000 so as not have a hanged connection. On SFTP this option is set as timeout on the JSCH Session instance.
soTimeout.title: So Timeout

timeout.description: Sets the data timeout for waiting for reply Used only by FTPClient
timeout.title: Timeout

knownHostsFile.description: Sets the known_hosts file, so that the jsch endpoint can do host key verification. You can prefix with classpath: to load the file from classpath instead of file system.
knownHostsFile.title: Known Hosts File

preferredAuthentications.description: Set a comma separated list of authentications that will be used in order of preference. Possible authentication methods are defined by JCraft JSCH. Some examples include: gssapi-with-mic,publickey,keyboard-interactive,password If not specified the JSCH and/or system defaults will be used.
preferredAuthentications.title: Preferred Authentications

privateKeyBytes.description: Set the private key bytes to that the endpoint can do private key verification. This must be used only if privateKeyFile wasn't set. Otherwise the file will have the priority.
privateKeyBytes.title: Private Key Bytes

privateKeyFile.description: Set the private key file to that the endpoint can do private key verification. You can prefix with classpath: to load the file from classpath instead of file system.
privateKeyFile.title: Private Key File

privateKeyFilePassphrase.description: Set the private key file passphrase to that the endpoint can do private key verification.
privateKeyFilePassphrase.title: Private Key File Passphrase

useUserKnownHostsFile.description: If knownHostFile has not been explicit configured, then use the host file from System.getProperty(user.home) /.ssh/known_hosts
useUserKnownHostsFile.title: Use User Known Hosts File

ciphers.description: Set a comma separated list of ciphers that will be used in order of preference. Possible cipher names are defined by JCraft JSCH. Some examples include: aes128-ctr,aes128-cbc,3des-ctr,3des-cbc,blowfish-cbc,aes192-cbc,aes256-cbc. If not specified the default list from JSCH will be used.
ciphers.title: Ciphers

seda.title: SEDA
seda.description: Asynchronously call another endpoint from any Camel Context in the same JVM.

size.description: The maximum capacity of the SEDA queue (i.e., the number of messages it can hold). Will by default use the defaultSize set on the SEDA component.
size.title: Size

concurrentConsumers.description: Number of concurrent threads processing exchanges.
concurrentConsumers.title: Concurrent Consumers

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

limitConcurrentConsumers.description: Whether to limit the number of concurrentConsumers to the maximum of 500. By default, an exception will be thrown if an endpoint is configured with a greater number. You can disable that check by turning this option off.
limitConcurrentConsumers.title: Limit Concurrent Consumers

multipleConsumers.description: Specifies whether multiple consumers are allowed. If enabled, you can use SEDA for Publish-Subscribe messaging. That is, you can send a message to the SEDA queue and have each consumer receive a copy of the message. When enabled, this option should be specified on every consumer endpoint.
multipleConsumers.title: Multiple Consumers

pollTimeout.description: The timeout (in milliseconds) used when polling. When a timeout occurs, the consumer can check whether it is allowed to continue running. Setting a lower value allows the consumer to react more quickly upon shutdown.
pollTimeout.title: Poll Timeout

purgeWhenStopping.description: Whether to purge the task queue when stopping the consumer/route. This allows to stop faster, as any pending messages on the queue is discarded.
purgeWhenStopping.title: Purge When Stopping

blockWhenFull.description: Whether a thread that sends messages to a full SEDA queue will block until the queue's capacity is no longer exhausted. By default, an exception will be thrown stating that the queue is full. By enabling this option, the calling thread will instead block and wait until the message can be accepted.
blockWhenFull.title: Block When Full

discardIfNoConsumers.description: Whether the producer should discard the message (do not add the message to the queue), when sending to a queue with no active consumers. Only one of the options discardIfNoConsumers and failIfNoConsumers can be enabled at the same time.
discardIfNoConsumers.title: Discard If No Consumers

discardWhenFull.description: Whether a thread that sends messages to a full SEDA queue will be discarded. By default, an exception will be thrown stating that the queue is full. By enabling this option, the calling thread will give up sending and continue, meaning that the message was not sent to the SEDA queue.
discardWhenFull.title: Discard When Full

failIfNoConsumers.description: Whether the producer should fail by throwing an exception, when sending to a queue with no active consumers. Only one of the options discardIfNoConsumers and failIfNoConsumers can be enabled at the same time.
failIfNoConsumers.title: Fail If No Consumers

offerTimeout.description: Offer timeout (in milliseconds) can be added to the block case when queue is full. You can disable timeout by using 0 or a negative value.
offerTimeout.title: Offer Timeout

timeout.description: Timeout (in milliseconds) before a SEDA producer will stop waiting for an asynchronous task to complete. You can disable timeout by using 0 or a negative value.
timeout.title: Timeout

waitForTaskToComplete.description: Option to specify whether the caller should wait for the async task to complete or not before continuing. The following three options are supported: Always, Never or IfReplyExpected. The first two values are self-explanatory. The last value, IfReplyExpected, will only wait if the message is Request Reply based. The default option is IfReplyExpected.
waitForTaskToComplete.title: Wait For Task To Complete

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

queue.description: Define the queue instance which will be used by the endpoint
queue.title: Queue

service.title: Service
service.description: Register a Camel endpoint to a Service Registry (such as Consul, Etcd) and delegate to it.

delegateUri.description: The endpoint uri to expose as service
delegateUri.title: Delegate Uri

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

servicenow.title: ServiceNow
servicenow.description: Interact with ServiceNow via its REST API.

display.description: Set this parameter to true to return only scorecards where the indicator Display field is selected. Set this parameter to all to return scorecards with any Display field value. This parameter is true by default.
display.title: Display

displayValue.description: Return the display value (true), actual value (false), or both (all) for reference fields (default: false)
displayValue.title: Display Value

excludeReferenceLink.description: True to exclude Table API links for reference fields (default: false)
excludeReferenceLink.title: Exclude Reference Link

favorites.description: Set this parameter to true to return only scorecards that are favorites of the querying user.
favorites.title: Favorites

includeAggregates.description: Set this parameter to true to always return all available aggregates for an indicator, including when an aggregate has already been applied. If a value is not specified, this parameter defaults to false and returns no aggregates.
includeAggregates.title: Include Aggregates

includeAvailableAggregates.description: Set this parameter to true to return all available aggregates for an indicator when no aggregate has been applied. If a value is not specified, this parameter defaults to false and returns no aggregates.
includeAvailableAggregates.title: Include Available Aggregates

includeAvailableBreakdowns.description: Set this parameter to true to return all available breakdowns for an indicator. If a value is not specified, this parameter defaults to false and returns no breakdowns.
includeAvailableBreakdowns.title: Include Available Breakdowns

includeScoreNotes.description: Set this parameter to true to return all notes associated with the score. The note element contains the note text as well as the author and timestamp when the note was added.
includeScoreNotes.title: Include Score Notes

includeScores.description: Set this parameter to true to return all scores for a scorecard. If a value is not specified, this parameter defaults to false and returns only the most recent score value.
includeScores.title: Include Scores

inputDisplayValue.description: True to set raw value of input fields (default: false)
inputDisplayValue.title: Input Display Value

key.description: Set this parameter to true to return only scorecards for key indicators.
key.title: Key

models.description: Defines both request and response models
models.title: Models

perPage.description: Enter the maximum number of scorecards each query can return. By default this value is 10, and the maximum is 100.
perPage.title: Per Page

release.description: The ServiceNow release to target, default to Helsinki See https://docs.servicenow.com
release.title: Release

resource.description: The default resource, can be overridden by header CamelServiceNowResource
resource.title: Resource

sortBy.description: Specify the value to use when sorting results. By default, queries sort records by value.
sortBy.title: Sort By

sortDir.description: Specify the sort direction, ascending or descending. By default, queries sort records in descending order. Use sysparm_sortdir=asc to sort in ascending order.
sortDir.title: Sort Dir

suppressAutoSysField.description: True to suppress auto generation of system fields (default: false)
suppressAutoSysField.title: Suppress Auto Sys Field

suppressPaginationHeader.description: Set this value to true to remove the Link header from the response. The Link header allows you to request additional pages of data when the number of records matching your query exceeds the query limit
suppressPaginationHeader.title: Suppress Pagination Header

table.description: The default table, can be overridden by header CamelServiceNowTable
table.title: Table

target.description: Set this parameter to true to return only scorecards that have a target.
target.title: Target

topLevelOnly.description: Gets only those categories whose parent is a catalog.
topLevelOnly.title: Top Level Only

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

apiVersion.description: The ServiceNow REST API version, default latest
apiVersion.title: Api Version

dateFormat.description: The date format used for Json serialization/deserialization
dateFormat.title: Date Format

dateTimeFormat.description: The date-time format used for Json serialization/deserialization
dateTimeFormat.title: Date Time Format

mapper.description: Sets Jackson's ObjectMapper to use for request/reply
mapper.title: Mapper

retrieveTargetRecordOnImport.description: Set this parameter to true to retrieve the target record when using import set api. The import set result is then replaced by the target record
retrieveTargetRecordOnImport.title: Retrieve Target Record On Import

timeFormat.description: The time format used for Json serialization/deserialization
timeFormat.title: Time Format

proxyHost.description: The proxy host name
proxyHost.title: Proxy Host

proxyPort.description: The proxy port number
proxyPort.title: Proxy Port

password.description: ServiceNow account password, MUST be provided
password.title: Password

sslContextParameters.description: To configure security using SSLContextParameters. See http://camel.apache.org/camel-configuration-utilities.html
sslContextParameters.title: Ssl Context Parameters

userName.description: ServiceNow user account name, MUST be provided
userName.title: User Name

servlet.title: Servlet
servlet.description: Serve HTTP requests by a Servlet.

chunked.description: If this option is false the Servlet will disable the HTTP streaming and set the content-length header on the response
chunked.title: Chunked

disableStreamCache.description: Determines whether or not the raw input stream from Servlet is cached or not (Camel will read the stream into a in memory/overflow to file, Stream caching) cache. By default Camel will cache the Servlet input stream to support reading it multiple times to ensure it Camel can retrieve all data from the stream. However you can set this option to true when you for example need to access the raw stream, such as streaming it directly to a file or other persistent store. DefaultHttpBinding will copy the request input stream into a stream cache and put it into message body if this option is false to support reading the stream multiple times. If you use Servlet to bridge/proxy an endpoint then consider enabling this option to improve performance, in case you do not need to read the message payload multiple times. The http producer will by default cache the response body stream. If setting this option to true, then the producers will not cache the response body stream but use the response stream as-is as the message body.
disableStreamCache.title: Disable Stream Cache

headerFilterStrategy.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.
headerFilterStrategy.title: Header Filter Strategy

httpBinding.description: To use a custom HttpBinding to control the mapping between Camel message and HttpClient.
httpBinding.title: Http Binding

async.description: Configure the consumer to work in async mode
async.title: Async

httpMethodRestrict.description: Used to only allow consuming if the HttpMethod matches, such as GET/POST/PUT etc. Multiple methods can be specified separated by comma.
httpMethodRestrict.title: Http Method Restrict

matchOnUriPrefix.description: Whether or not the consumer should try to find a target consumer by matching the URI prefix if no exact match is found.
matchOnUriPrefix.title: Match On Uri Prefix

muteException.description: If enabled and an Exchange failed processing on the consumer side the response's body won't contain the exception's stack trace.
muteException.title: Mute Exception

responseBufferSize.description: To use a custom buffer size on the javax.servlet.ServletResponse.
responseBufferSize.title: Response Buffer Size

servletName.description: Name of the servlet to use
servletName.title: Servlet Name

transferException.description: If enabled and an Exchange failed processing on the consumer side, and if the caused Exception was send back serialized in the response as a application/x-java-serialized-object content type. On the producer side the exception will be deserialized and thrown as is, instead of the HttpOperationFailedException. The caused exception is required to be serialized. This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.
transferException.title: Transfer Exception

attachmentMultipartBinding.description: Whether to automatic bind multipart/form-data as attachments on the Camel Exchange. The options attachmentMultipartBinding=true and disableStreamCache=false cannot work together. Remove disableStreamCache to use AttachmentMultipartBinding. This is turn off by default as this may require servlet specific configuration to enable this when using Servlet's.
attachmentMultipartBinding.title: Attachment Multipart Binding

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

eagerCheckContentAvailable.description: Whether to eager check whether the HTTP requests has content if the content-length header is 0 or not present. This can be turned on in case HTTP clients do not send streamed data.
eagerCheckContentAvailable.title: Eager Check Content Available

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

fileNameExtWhitelist.description: Whitelist of accepted filename extensions for accepting uploaded files. Multiple extensions can be separated by comma, such as txt,xml.
fileNameExtWhitelist.title: File Name Ext Whitelist

mapHttpMessageBody.description: If this option is true then IN exchange Body of the exchange will be mapped to HTTP body. Setting this to false will avoid the HTTP mapping.
mapHttpMessageBody.title: Map Http Message Body

mapHttpMessageFormUrlEncodedBody.description: If this option is true then IN exchange Form Encoded body of the exchange will be mapped to HTTP. Setting this to false will avoid the HTTP Form Encoded body mapping.
mapHttpMessageFormUrlEncodedBody.title: Map Http Message Form Url Encoded Body

mapHttpMessageHeaders.description: If this option is true then IN exchange Headers of the exchange will be mapped to HTTP headers. Setting this to false will avoid the HTTP Headers mapping.
mapHttpMessageHeaders.title: Map Http Message Headers

optionsEnabled.description: Specifies whether to enable HTTP OPTIONS for this Servlet consumer. By default OPTIONS is turned off.
optionsEnabled.title: Options Enabled

traceEnabled.description: Specifies whether to enable HTTP TRACE for this Servlet consumer. By default TRACE is turned off.
traceEnabled.title: Trace Enabled

sftp.title: SFTP
sftp.description: Upload and download files to/from SFTP servers.

port.description: Port of the FTP server
port.title: Port

binary.description: Specifies the file transfer mode, BINARY or ASCII. Default is ASCII (false).
binary.title: Binary

charset.description: This option is used to specify the encoding of the file. You can use this on the consumer, to specify the encodings of the files, which allow Camel to know the charset it should load the file content in case the file content is being accessed. Likewise when writing a file, you can use this option to specify which charset to write the file as well. Do mind that when writing the file Camel may have to read the message content into memory to be able to convert the data into the configured charset, so do not use this if you have big messages.
charset.title: Charset

disconnect.description: Whether or not to disconnect from remote FTP server right after use. Disconnect will only disconnect the current connection to the FTP server. If you have a consumer which you want to stop, then you need to stop the consumer/route instead.
disconnect.title: Disconnect

doneFileName.description: Producer: If provided, then Camel will write a 2nd done file when the original file has been written. The done file will be empty. This option configures what file name to use. Either you can specify a fixed name. Or you can use dynamic placeholders. The done file will always be written in the same folder as the original file. Consumer: If provided, Camel will only consume files if a done file exists. This option configures what file name to use. Either you can specify a fixed name. Or you can use dynamic placeholders.The done file is always expected in the same folder as the original file. Only ${file.name} and ${file.name.next} is supported as dynamic placeholders.
doneFileName.title: Done File Name

fileName.description: Use Expression such as File Language to dynamically set the filename. For consumers, it's used as a filename filter. For producers, it's used to evaluate the filename to write. If an expression is set, it take precedence over the CamelFileName header. (Note: The header itself can also be an Expression). The expression options support both String and Expression types. If the expression is a String type, it is always evaluated using the File Language. If the expression is an Expression type, the specified Expression type is used - this allows you, for instance, to use OGNL expressions. For the consumer, you can use it to filter filenames, so you can for instance consume today's file using the File Language syntax: mydata-${date:now:yyyyMMdd}.txt. The producers support the CamelOverruleFileName header which takes precedence over any existing CamelFileName header; the CamelOverruleFileName is a header that is used only once, and makes it easier as this avoids to temporary store CamelFileName and have to restore it afterwards.
fileName.title: File Name

jschLoggingLevel.description: The logging level to use for JSCH activity logging. As JSCH is verbose at by default at INFO level the threshold is WARN by default.
jschLoggingLevel.title: Jsch Logging Level

passiveMode.description: Sets passive mode connections. Default is active mode connections.
passiveMode.title: Passive Mode

separator.description: Sets the path separator to be used. UNIX = Uses unix style path separator Windows = Uses windows style path separator Auto = (is default) Use existing path separator in file name
separator.title: Separator

fastExistsCheck.description: If set this option to be true, camel-ftp will use the list file directly to check if the file exists.
