spring-rabbitmq.title: Spring RabbitMQ
spring-rabbitmq.description: Send and receive messages from RabbitMQ using Spring RabbitMQ client.

exchangeName.description: The exchange name determines the exchange to which the produced messages will be sent to. In the case of consumers, the exchange name determines the exchange the queue will be bound to. Note: to use default exchange then do not use empty name, but use default instead.
exchangeName.title: Exchange Name

connectionFactory.description: The connection factory to be use. A connection factory must be configured either on the component or endpoint.
connectionFactory.title: Connection Factory

disableReplyTo.description: Specifies whether Camel ignores the ReplyTo header in messages. If true, Camel does not send a reply back to the destination specified in the ReplyTo header. You can use this option if you want Camel to consume from a route and you do not want Camel to automatically send back a reply message because another component in your code handles the reply message. You can also use this option if you want to use Camel as a proxy between different message brokers and you want to route message from one system to another.
disableReplyTo.title: Disable Reply To

routingKey.description: The value of a routing key to use. Default is empty which is not helpful when using the default (or any direct) exchange, but fine if the exchange is a headers exchange for instance.
routingKey.title: Routing Key

testConnectionOnStartup.description: Specifies whether to test the connection on startup. This ensures that when Camel starts that all the JMS consumers have a valid connection to the JMS broker. If a connection cannot be granted then Camel throws an exception on startup. This ensures that Camel is not started with failed connections. The JMS producers is tested as well.
testConnectionOnStartup.title: Test Connection On Startup

acknowledgeMode.description: Flag controlling the behaviour of the container with respect to message acknowledgement. The most common usage is to let the container handle the acknowledgements (so the listener doesn't need to know about the channel or the message). Set to AcknowledgeMode.MANUAL if the listener will send the acknowledgements itself using Channel.basicAck(long, boolean). Manual acks are consistent with either a transactional or non-transactional channel, but if you are doing no other work on the channel at the same other than receiving a single message then the transaction is probably unnecessary. Set to AcknowledgeMode.NONE to tell the broker not to expect any acknowledgements, and it will assume all messages are acknowledged as soon as they are sent (this is autoack in native Rabbit broker terms). If AcknowledgeMode.NONE then the channel cannot be transactional (so the container will fail on start up if that flag is accidentally set).
acknowledgeMode.title: Acknowledge Mode

asyncConsumer.description: Whether the consumer processes the Exchange asynchronously. If enabled then the consumer may pickup the next message from the queue, while the previous message is being processed asynchronously (by the Asynchronous Routing Engine). This means that messages may be processed not 100% strictly in order. If disabled (as default) then the Exchange is fully processed before the consumer will pickup the next message from the queue.
asyncConsumer.title: Async Consumer

autoDeclare.description: Specifies whether the consumer should auto declare binding between exchange, queue and routing key when starting.
autoDeclare.title: Auto Declare

autoStartup.description: Specifies whether the consumer container should auto-startup.
autoStartup.title: Auto Startup

deadLetterExchange.description: The name of the dead letter exchange
deadLetterExchange.title: Dead Letter Exchange

deadLetterExchangeType.description: The type of the dead letter exchange
deadLetterExchangeType.title: Dead Letter Exchange Type

deadLetterQueue.description: The name of the dead letter queue
deadLetterQueue.title: Dead Letter Queue

deadLetterRoutingKey.description: The routing key for the dead letter exchange
deadLetterRoutingKey.title: Dead Letter Routing Key

exclusive.description: Set to true for an exclusive consumer
exclusive.title: Exclusive

maximumRetryAttempts.description: How many times a Rabbitmq consumer will retry the same message if Camel failed to process the message
maximumRetryAttempts.title: Maximum Retry Attempts

noLocal.description: Set to true for an no-local consumer
noLocal.title: No Local

queues.description: The queue(s) to use for consuming messages. Multiple queue names can be separated by comma. If none has been configured then Camel will generate an unique id as the queue name for the consumer.
queues.title: Queues

rejectAndDontRequeue.description: Whether a Rabbitmq consumer should reject the message without requeuing. This enables failed messages to be sent to a Dead Letter Exchange/Queue, if the broker is so configured.
rejectAndDontRequeue.title: Reject And Dont Requeue

retryDelay.description: Delay in msec a Rabbitmq consumer will wait before redelivering a message that Camel failed to process
retryDelay.title: Retry Delay

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

maxConcurrentConsumers.description: The maximum number of consumers (available only with SMLC)
maxConcurrentConsumers.title: Max Concurrent Consumers

prefetchCount.description: Tell the broker how many messages to send in a single request. Often this can be set quite high to improve throughput.
prefetchCount.title: Prefetch Count

retry.description: Custom retry configuration to use. If this is configured then the other settings such as maximumRetryAttempts for retry are not in use.
retry.title: Retry

replyTimeout.description: Specify the timeout in milliseconds to be used when waiting for a reply message when doing request/reply messaging. The default value is 5 seconds. A negative value indicates an indefinite timeout.
replyTimeout.title: Reply Timeout

usePublisherConnection.description: Use a separate connection for publishers and consumers
usePublisherConnection.title: Use Publisher Connection

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

args.description: Specify arguments for configuring the different RabbitMQ concepts, a different prefix is required for each element: arg.consumer. arg.exchange. arg.queue. arg.binding. arg.dlq.exchange. arg.dlq.queue. arg.dlq.binding. For example to declare a queue with message ttl argument: args=arg.queue.x-message-ttl=60000
args.title: Args

messageConverter.description: To use a custom MessageConverter so you can be in control how to map to/from a org.springframework.amqp.core.Message.
messageConverter.title: Message Converter

messagePropertiesConverter.description: To use a custom MessagePropertiesConverter so you can be in control how to map to/from a org.springframework.amqp.core.MessageProperties.
messagePropertiesConverter.title: Message Properties Converter

synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used
synchronous.title: Synchronous

spring-redis.title: Spring Redis
spring-redis.description: Send and receive messages from Redis.

host.description: The host where Redis server is running.
host.title: Host

port.description: Redis server port number
port.title: Port

channels.description: List of topic names or name patterns to subscribe to. Multiple names can be separated by comma.
channels.title: Channels

command.description: Default command, which can be overridden by message header. Notice the consumer only supports the following commands: PSUBSCRIBE and SUBSCRIBE
command.title: Command

connectionFactory.description: Reference to a pre-configured RedisConnectionFactory instance to use.
connectionFactory.title: Connection Factory

redisTemplate.description: Reference to a pre-configured RedisTemplate instance to use.
redisTemplate.title: Redis Template

serializer.description: Reference to a pre-configured RedisSerializer instance to use.
serializer.title: Serializer

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

listenerContainer.description: Reference to a pre-configured RedisMessageListenerContainer instance to use.
listenerContainer.title: Listener Container

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

spring-ws.title: Spring WebService
spring-ws.description: Access external web services as a client or expose your own web services.

type.description: Endpoint mapping type if endpoint mapping is used. rootqname - Offers the option to map web service requests based on the qualified name of the root element contained in the message. soapaction - Used to map web service requests based on the SOAP action specified in the header of the message. uri - In order to map web service requests that target a specific URI. xpathresult - Used to map web service requests based on the evaluation of an XPath expression against the incoming message. The result of the evaluation should match the XPath result specified in the endpoint URI. beanname - Allows you to reference an org.apache.camel.component.spring.ws.bean.CamelEndpointDispatcher object in order to integrate with existing (legacy) endpoint mappings like PayloadRootQNameEndpointMapping, SoapActionEndpointMapping, etc
type.title: Type

lookupKey.description: Endpoint mapping key if endpoint mapping is used
lookupKey.title: Lookup Key

webServiceEndpointUri.description: The default Web Service endpoint uri to use for the producer.
webServiceEndpointUri.title: Web Service Endpoint Uri

expression.description: The XPath expression to use when option type=xpathresult. Then this option is required to be configured.
expression.title: Expression

messageFilter.description: Option to provide a custom MessageFilter. For example when you want to process your headers or attachments by your own.
messageFilter.title: Message Filter

messageIdStrategy.description: Option to provide a custom MessageIdStrategy to control generation of WS-Addressing unique message ids.
messageIdStrategy.title: Message Id Strategy

endpointDispatcher.description: Spring org.springframework.ws.server.endpoint.MessageEndpoint for dispatching messages received by Spring-WS to a Camel endpoint, to integrate with existing (legacy) endpoint mappings like PayloadRootQNameEndpointMapping, SoapActionEndpointMapping, etc.
endpointDispatcher.title: Endpoint Dispatcher

endpointMapping.description: Reference to an instance of org.apache.camel.component.spring.ws.bean.CamelEndpointMapping in the Registry/ApplicationContext. Only one bean is required in the registry to serve all Camel/Spring-WS endpoints. This bean is auto-discovered by the MessageDispatcher and used to map requests to Camel endpoints based on characteristics specified on the endpoint (like root QName, SOAP action, etc)
endpointMapping.title: Endpoint Mapping

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

allowResponseAttachmentOverride.description: Option to override soap response attachments in in/out exchange with attachments from the actual service layer. If the invoked service appends or rewrites the soap attachments this option when set to true, allows the modified soap attachments to be overwritten in in/out message attachments
allowResponseAttachmentOverride.title: Allow Response Attachment Override

allowResponseHeaderOverride.description: Option to override soap response header in in/out exchange with header info from the actual service layer. If the invoked service appends or rewrites the soap header this option when set to true, allows the modified soap header to be overwritten in in/out message headers
allowResponseHeaderOverride.title: Allow Response Header Override

faultAction.description: Signifies the value for the faultAction response WS-Addressing Fault Action header that is provided by the method. See org.springframework.ws.soap.addressing.server.annotation.Action annotation for more details.
faultAction.title: Fault Action

faultTo.description: Signifies the value for the faultAction response WS-Addressing FaultTo header that is provided by the method. See org.springframework.ws.soap.addressing.server.annotation.Action annotation for more details.
faultTo.title: Fault To

messageFactory.description: Option to provide a custom WebServiceMessageFactory. For example when you want Apache Axiom to handle web service messages instead of SAAJ.
messageFactory.title: Message Factory

messageSender.description: Option to provide a custom WebServiceMessageSender. For example to perform authentication or use alternative transports
messageSender.title: Message Sender

outputAction.description: Signifies the value for the response WS-Addressing Action header that is provided by the method. See org.springframework.ws.soap.addressing.server.annotation.Action annotation for more details.
outputAction.title: Output Action

replyTo.description: Signifies the value for the replyTo response WS-Addressing ReplyTo header that is provided by the method. See org.springframework.ws.soap.addressing.server.annotation.Action annotation for more details.
replyTo.title: Reply To

soapAction.description: SOAP action to include inside a SOAP request when accessing remote web services
soapAction.title: Soap Action

timeout.description: Sets the socket read timeout (in milliseconds) while invoking a webservice using the producer, see URLConnection.setReadTimeout() and CommonsHttpMessageSender.setReadTimeout(). This option works when using the built-in message sender implementations: CommonsHttpMessageSender and HttpUrlConnectionMessageSender. One of these implementations will be used by default for HTTP based services unless you customize the Spring WS configuration options supplied to the component. If you are using a non-standard sender, it is assumed that you will handle your own timeout configuration. The built-in message sender HttpComponentsMessageSender is considered instead of CommonsHttpMessageSender which has been deprecated, see HttpComponentsMessageSender.setReadTimeout().
timeout.title: Timeout

webServiceTemplate.description: Option to provide a custom WebServiceTemplate. This allows for full control over client-side web services handling; like adding a custom interceptor or specifying a fault resolver, message sender or message factory.
webServiceTemplate.title: Web Service Template

wsAddressingAction.description: WS-Addressing 1.0 action header to include when accessing web services. The To header is set to the address of the web service as specified in the endpoint URI (default Spring-WS behavior).
wsAddressingAction.title: Ws Addressing Action

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

sql.title: SQL
sql.description: Perform SQL queries using Spring JDBC.

query.description: Sets the SQL query to perform. You can externalize the query by using file: or classpath: as prefix and specify the location of the file.
query.title: Query

allowNamedParameters.description: Whether to allow using named parameters in the queries.
allowNamedParameters.title: Allow Named Parameters

dataSource.description: Sets the DataSource to use to communicate with the database at endpoint level.
dataSource.title: Data Source

outputClass.description: Specify the full package and class name to use as conversion when outputType=SelectOne.
outputClass.title: Output Class

outputHeader.description: Store the query result in a header instead of the message body. By default, outputHeader == null and the query result is stored in the message body, any existing content in the message body is discarded. If outputHeader is set, the value is used as the name of the header to store the query result and the original message body is preserved.
outputHeader.title: Output Header

outputType.description: Make the output of consumer or producer to SelectList as List of Map, or SelectOne as single Java object in the following way: a) If the query has only single column, then that JDBC Column object is returned. (such as SELECT COUNT( ) FROM PROJECT will return a Long object. b) If the query has more than one column, then it will return a Map of that result. c) If the outputClass is set, then it will convert the query result into an Java bean object by calling all the setters that match the column names. It will assume your class has a default constructor to create instance with. d) If the query resulted in more than one rows, it throws an non-unique result exception. StreamList streams the result of the query using an Iterator. This can be used with the Splitter EIP in streaming mode to process the ResultSet in streaming fashion.
outputType.title: Output Type

separator.description: The separator to use when parameter values is taken from message body (if the body is a String type), to be inserted at # placeholders. Notice if you use named parameters, then a Map type is used instead. The default value is comma
separator.title: Separator

breakBatchOnConsumeFail.description: Sets whether to break batch if onConsume failed.
breakBatchOnConsumeFail.title: Break Batch On Consume Fail

expectedUpdateCount.description: Sets an expected update count to validate when using onConsume.
expectedUpdateCount.title: Expected Update Count

maxMessagesPerPoll.description: Sets the maximum number of messages to poll
maxMessagesPerPoll.title: Max Messages Per Poll

onConsume.description: After processing each row then this query can be executed, if the Exchange was processed successfully, for example to mark the row as processed. The query can have parameter.
onConsume.title: On Consume

onConsumeBatchComplete.description: After processing the entire batch, this query can be executed to bulk update rows etc. The query cannot have parameters.
onConsumeBatchComplete.title: On Consume Batch Complete

onConsumeFailed.description: After processing each row then this query can be executed, if the Exchange failed, for example to mark the row as failed. The query can have parameter.
onConsumeFailed.title: On Consume Failed

routeEmptyResultSet.description: Sets whether empty resultset should be allowed to be sent to the next hop. Defaults to false. So the empty resultset will be filtered out.
routeEmptyResultSet.title: Route Empty Result Set

sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.
sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.title: Send Empty Message When Idle

transacted.description: Enables or disables transaction. If enabled then if processing an exchange failed then the consumer breaks out processing any further exchanges to cause a rollback eager.
transacted.title: Transacted

useIterator.description: Sets how resultset should be delivered to route. Indicates delivery as either a list or individual object. defaults to true.
useIterator.title: Use Iterator

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.
pollStrategy.title: Poll Strategy

processingStrategy.description: Allows to plugin to use a custom org.apache.camel.component.sql.SqlProcessingStrategy to execute queries when the consumer has processed the rows/batch.
processingStrategy.title: Processing Strategy

noop.description: If set, will ignore the results of the SQL query and use the existing IN message as the OUT message for the continuation of processing
noop.title: Noop

useMessageBodyForSql.description: Whether to use the message body as the SQL and then headers for parameters. If this option is enabled then the SQL in the uri is not used. Note that query parameters in the message body are represented by a question mark instead of a # symbol.
useMessageBodyForSql.title: Use Message Body For Sql

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

alwaysPopulateStatement.description: If enabled then the populateStatement method from org.apache.camel.component.sql.SqlPrepareStatementStrategy is always invoked, also if there is no expected parameters to be prepared. When this is false then the populateStatement is only invoked if there is 1 or more expected parameters to be set; for example this avoids reading the message body/headers for SQL queries with no parameters.
alwaysPopulateStatement.title: Always Populate Statement

parametersCount.description: If set greater than zero, then Camel will use this count value of parameters to replace instead of querying via JDBC metadata API. This is useful if the JDBC vendor could not return correct parameters count, then user may override instead.
parametersCount.title: Parameters Count

placeholder.description: Specifies a character that will be replaced to in SQL query. Notice, that it is simple String.replaceAll() operation and no SQL parsing is involved (quoted strings will also change).
placeholder.title: Placeholder

prepareStatementStrategy.description: Allows to plugin to use a custom org.apache.camel.component.sql.SqlPrepareStatementStrategy to control preparation of the query and prepared statement.
prepareStatementStrategy.title: Prepare Statement Strategy

templateOptions.description: Configures the Spring JdbcTemplate with the key/values from the Map
templateOptions.title: Template Options

usePlaceholder.description: Sets whether to use placeholder and replace all placeholder characters with sign in the SQL queries.
usePlaceholder.title: Use Placeholder

backoffErrorThreshold.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.
backoffErrorThreshold.title: Backoff Error Threshold

backoffIdleThreshold.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.
backoffIdleThreshold.title: Backoff Idle Threshold

backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.
backoffMultiplier.title: Backoff Multiplier

greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.
greedy.title: Greedy

initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.
initialDelay.title: Initial Delay

repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.
repeatCount.title: Repeat Count

runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.
runLoggingLevel.title: Run Logging Level

scheduledExecutorService.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.
scheduledExecutorService.title: Scheduled Executor Service

scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler
scheduler.title: Scheduler

schedulerProperties.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.
schedulerProperties.title: Scheduler Properties

startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.
startScheduler.title: Start Scheduler

timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.
timeUnit.title: Time Unit

useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.
useFixedDelay.title: Use Fixed Delay

sql-stored.title: SQL Stored Procedure
sql-stored.description: Perform SQL queries as a JDBC Stored Procedures using Spring JDBC.

template.description: Sets the StoredProcedure template to perform
template.title: Template

dataSource.description: Sets the DataSource to use to communicate with the database.
dataSource.title: Data Source

function.description: Whether this call is for a function.
function.title: Function

noop.description: If set, will ignore the results of the template and use the existing IN message as the OUT message for the continuation of processing
noop.title: Noop

outputHeader.description: Store the template result in a header instead of the message body. By default, outputHeader == null and the template result is stored in the message body, any existing content in the message body is discarded. If outputHeader is set, the value is used as the name of the header to store the template result and the original message body is preserved.
outputHeader.title: Output Header

useMessageBodyForTemplate.description: Whether to use the message body as the template and then headers for parameters. If this option is enabled then the template in the uri is not used.
useMessageBodyForTemplate.title: Use Message Body For Template

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

templateOptions.description: Configures the Spring JdbcTemplate with the key/values from the Map
templateOptions.title: Template Options

ssh.title: SSH
ssh.description: Execute commands on remote hosts using SSH.

host.description: Sets the hostname of the remote SSH server.
host.title: Host

port.description: Sets the port number for the remote SSH server.
port.title: Port

failOnUnknownHost.description: Specifies whether a connection to an unknown host should fail or not. This value is only checked when the property knownHosts is set.
failOnUnknownHost.title: Fail On Unknown Host

knownHostsResource.description: Sets the resource path for a known_hosts file
knownHostsResource.title: Known Hosts Resource

timeout.description: Sets the timeout in milliseconds to wait in establishing the remote SSH server connection. Defaults to 30000 milliseconds.
timeout.title: Timeout

pollCommand.description: Sets the command string to send to the remote SSH server during every poll cycle. Only works with camel-ssh component being used as a consumer, i.e. from(ssh://...) You may need to end your command with a newline, and that must be URL encoded %0A
pollCommand.title: Poll Command

sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.
sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.title: Send Empty Message When Idle

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.
pollStrategy.title: Poll Strategy

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

channelType.description: Sets the channel type to pass to the Channel as part of command execution. Defaults to exec.
channelType.title: Channel Type

shellPrompt.description: Sets the shellPrompt to be dropped when response is read after command execution
shellPrompt.title: Shell Prompt

sleepForShellPrompt.description: Sets the sleep period in milliseconds to wait reading response from shell prompt. Defaults to 100 milliseconds.
sleepForShellPrompt.title: Sleep For Shell Prompt

backoffErrorThreshold.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.
backoffErrorThreshold.title: Backoff Error Threshold

backoffIdleThreshold.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.
backoffIdleThreshold.title: Backoff Idle Threshold

backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.
backoffMultiplier.title: Backoff Multiplier

greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.
greedy.title: Greedy

initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.
initialDelay.title: Initial Delay

repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.
repeatCount.title: Repeat Count

runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.
runLoggingLevel.title: Run Logging Level

scheduledExecutorService.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.
scheduledExecutorService.title: Scheduled Executor Service

scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler
scheduler.title: Scheduler

schedulerProperties.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.
schedulerProperties.title: Scheduler Properties

startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.
startScheduler.title: Start Scheduler

timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.
timeUnit.title: Time Unit

useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.
useFixedDelay.title: Use Fixed Delay

certResource.description: Sets the resource path of the certificate to use for Authentication. Will use ResourceHelperKeyPairProvider to resolve file based certificate, and depends on keyType setting.
certResource.title: Cert Resource

certResourcePassword.description: Sets the password to use in loading certResource, if certResource is an encrypted key.
certResourcePassword.title: Cert Resource Password

keyPairProvider.description: Sets the KeyPairProvider reference to use when connecting using Certificates to the remote SSH Server.
keyPairProvider.title: Key Pair Provider

keyType.description: Sets the key type to pass to the KeyPairProvider as part of authentication. KeyPairProvider.loadKey(...) will be passed this value. From Camel 3.0.0 / 2.25.0, by default Camel will select the first available KeyPair that is loaded. Prior to this, a KeyType of 'ssh-rsa' was enforced by default.
keyType.title: Key Type

password.description: Sets the password to use in connecting to remote SSH server. Requires keyPairProvider to be set to null.
password.title: Password

username.description: Sets the username to use in logging into the remote SSH server.
username.title: Username

stax.title: StAX
stax.description: Process XML payloads by a SAX ContentHandler.

contentHandlerClass.description: The FQN class name for the ContentHandler implementation to use.
contentHandlerClass.title: Content Handler Class

By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

stitch.title: Stitch
stitch.description: Stitch is a cloud ETL service that integrates various data sources into a central data warehouse through various integrations.

tableName.description: The name of the destination table the data is being pushed to. Table names must be unique in each destination schema, or loading issues will occur. Note: The number of characters in the table name should be within the destination's allowed limits or data will rejected.
tableName.title: Table Name

keyNames.description: A collection of comma separated strings representing the Primary Key fields in the source table. Stitch use these Primary Keys to de-dupe data during loading If not provided, the table will be loaded in an append-only manner.
keyNames.title: Key Names

region.description: Stitch account region, e.g: europe
region.title: Region

stitchSchema.description: A schema that describes the record(s)
stitchSchema.title: Stitch Schema

connectionProvider.description: ConnectionProvider contain configuration for the HttpClient like Maximum connection limit .. etc, you can inject this ConnectionProvider and the StitchClient will initialize HttpClient with this ConnectionProvider
connectionProvider.title: Connection Provider

httpClient.description: Reactor Netty HttpClient, you can injected it if you want to have custom HttpClient
httpClient.title: Http Client

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

stitchClient.description: Set a custom StitchClient that implements org.apache.camel.component.stitch.client.StitchClient interface
stitchClient.title: Stitch Client

token.description: Stitch access token for the Stitch Import API
token.title: Token

stomp.title: Stomp
stomp.description: Send and rececive messages to/from STOMP (Simple Text Oriented Messaging Protocol) compliant message brokers.

brokerURL.description: The URI of the Stomp broker to connect to
brokerURL.title: Broker URL

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

headerFilterStrategy.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.
headerFilterStrategy.title: Header Filter Strategy

stream.title: Stream
stream.description: Read from system-in and write to system-out and system-err streams.

kind.description: Kind of stream to use such as System.in, System.out, a file, or a http url.
kind.title: Kind

encoding.description: You can configure the encoding (is a charset name) to use text-based streams (for example, message body is a String object). If not provided, Camel uses the JVM default Charset.
encoding.title: Encoding

fileName.description: When using the stream:file URI format, this option specifies the filename to stream to/from.
fileName.title: File Name

fileWatcher.description: To use JVM file watcher to listen for file change events to support re-loading files that may be overwritten, somewhat like tail --retry
fileWatcher.title: File Watcher

groupLines.description: To group X number of lines in the consumer. For example to group 10 lines and therefore only spit out an Exchange with 10 lines, instead of 1 Exchange per line.
groupLines.title: Group Lines

groupStrategy.description: Allows to use a custom GroupStrategy to control how to group lines.
groupStrategy.title: Group Strategy

httpHeaders.description: When using stream:http format, this option specifies optional http headers, such as Accept: application/json. Multiple headers can be separated by comma.
httpHeaders.title: Http Headers

httpUrl.description: When using stream:http format, this option specifies the http url to stream from.
httpUrl.title: Http Url

initialPromptDelay.description: Initial delay in milliseconds before showing the message prompt. This delay occurs only once. Can be used during system startup to avoid message prompts being written while other logging is done to the system out.
initialPromptDelay.title: Initial Prompt Delay

promptDelay.description: Optional delay in milliseconds before showing the message prompt.
promptDelay.title: Prompt Delay

promptMessage.description: Message prompt to use when reading from stream:in; for example, you could set this to Enter a command:
promptMessage.title: Prompt Message

readLine.description: Whether to read the input stream in line mode (terminate by line breaks). Setting this to false, will instead read the entire stream until EOL.
readLine.title: Read Line

retry.description: Will retry opening the stream if it's overwritten, somewhat like tail --retry If reading from files then you should also enable the fileWatcher option, to make it work reliable.
retry.title: Retry

scanStream.description: To be used for continuously reading a stream such as the unix tail command.
scanStream.title: Scan Stream

scanStreamDelay.description: Delay in milliseconds between read attempts when using scanStream.
scanStreamDelay.title: Scan Stream Delay

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

appendNewLine.description: Whether to append a new line character at end of output.
appendNewLine.title: Append New Line

autoCloseCount.description: Number of messages to process before closing stream on Producer side. Never close stream by default (only when Producer is stopped). If more messages are sent, the stream is reopened for another autoCloseCount batch.
autoCloseCount.title: Auto Close Count

closeOnDone.description: This option is used in combination with Splitter and streaming to the same file. The idea is to keep the stream open and only close when the Splitter is done, to improve performance. Mind this requires that you only stream to the same file, and not 2 or more files.
closeOnDone.title: Close On Done

delay.description: Initial delay in milliseconds before producing the stream.
delay.title: Delay

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

readTimeout.description: Sets the read timeout to a specified timeout, in milliseconds. A non-zero value specifies the timeout when reading from Input stream when a connection is established to a resource. If the timeout expires before there is data available for read, a java.net.SocketTimeoutException is raised. A timeout of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout.
readTimeout.title: Read Timeout

resourceUri.description: Path to the resource. You can prefix with: classpath, file, http, ref, or bean. classpath, file and http loads the resource using these protocols (classpath is default). ref will lookup the resource in the registry. bean will call a method on a bean to be used as the resource. For bean you can specify the method name after dot, eg bean:myBean.myMethod.
resourceUri.title: Resource Uri

allowContextMapAll.description: Sets whether the context map should allow access to all details. By default only the message body and headers can be accessed. This option can be enabled for full access to the current Exchange and CamelContext. Doing so impose a potential security risk as this opens access to the full power of CamelContext API.
allowContextMapAll.title: Allow Context Map All

allowTemplateFromHeader.description: Whether to allow to use resource template from header or not (default false). Enabling this allows to specify dynamic templates via message header. However this can be seen as a potential security vulnerability if the header is coming from a malicious user, so use this with care.
allowTemplateFromHeader.title: Allow Template From Header

contentCache.description: Sets whether to use resource content cache or not
contentCache.title: Content Cache

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

stub.title: Stub
stub.description: Stub out any physical endpoints while in development or testing.

size.description: The maximum capacity of the SEDA queue (i.e., the number of messages it can hold). Will by default use the defaultSize set on the SEDA component.
size.title: Size

concurrentConsumers.description: Number of concurrent threads processing exchanges.
concurrentConsumers.title: Concurrent Consumers

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

limitConcurrentConsumers.description: Whether to limit the number of concurrentConsumers to the maximum of 500. By default, an exception will be thrown if an endpoint is configured with a greater number. You can disable that check by turning this option off.
limitConcurrentConsumers.title: Limit Concurrent Consumers

multipleConsumers.description: Specifies whether multiple consumers are allowed. If enabled, you can use SEDA for Publish-Subscribe messaging. That is, you can send a message to the SEDA queue and have each consumer receive a copy of the message. When enabled, this option should be specified on every consumer endpoint.
multipleConsumers.title: Multiple Consumers

pollTimeout.description: The timeout (in milliseconds) used when polling. When a timeout occurs, the consumer can check whether it is allowed to continue running. Setting a lower value allows the consumer to react more quickly upon shutdown.
pollTimeout.title: Poll Timeout

purgeWhenStopping.description: Whether to purge the task queue when stopping the consumer/route. This allows to stop faster, as any pending messages on the queue is discarded.
purgeWhenStopping.title: Purge When Stopping

blockWhenFull.description: Whether a thread that sends messages to a full SEDA queue will block until the queue's capacity is no longer exhausted. By default, an exception will be thrown stating that the queue is full. By enabling this option, the calling thread will instead block and wait until the message can be accepted.
blockWhenFull.title: Block When Full

discardIfNoConsumers.description: Whether the producer should discard the message (do not add the message to the queue), when sending to a queue with no active consumers. Only one of the options discardIfNoConsumers and failIfNoConsumers can be enabled at the same time.
discardIfNoConsumers.title: Discard If No Consumers

discardWhenFull.description: Whether a thread that sends messages to a full SEDA queue will be discarded. By default, an exception will be thrown stating that the queue is full. By enabling this option, the calling thread will give up sending and continue, meaning that the message was not sent to the SEDA queue.
discardWhenFull.title: Discard When Full

failIfNoConsumers.description: Whether the producer should fail by throwing an exception, when sending to a queue with no active consumers. Only one of the options discardIfNoConsumers and failIfNoConsumers can be enabled at the same time.
failIfNoConsumers.title: Fail If No Consumers

offerTimeout.description: Offer timeout (in milliseconds) can be added to the block case when queue is full. You can disable timeout by using 0 or a negative value.
offerTimeout.title: Offer Timeout

timeout.description: Timeout (in milliseconds) before a SEDA producer will stop waiting for an asynchronous task to complete. You can disable timeout by using 0 or a negative value.
timeout.title: Timeout

waitForTaskToComplete.description: Option to specify whether the caller should wait for the async task to complete or not before continuing. The following three options are supported: Always, Never or IfReplyExpected. The first two values are self-explanatory. The last value, IfReplyExpected, will only wait if the message is Request Reply based. The default option is IfReplyExpected.
waitForTaskToComplete.title: Wait For Task To Complete

lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

queue.description: Define the queue instance which will be used by the endpoint
queue.title: Queue

telegram.title: Telegram
telegram.description: Send and receive messages acting as a Telegram Bot Telegram Bot API.

type.description: The endpoint type. Currently, only the 'bots' type is supported.
type.title: Type

limit.description: Limit on the number of updates that can be received in a single polling request.
limit.title: Limit

sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.
sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.title: Send Empty Message When Idle

timeout.description: Timeout in seconds for long polling. Put 0 for short polling or a bigger number for long polling. Long polling produces shorter response time.
timeout.title: Timeout

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
bridgeErrorHandler.title: Bridge Error Handler

exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
exceptionHandler.title: Exception Handler

exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.
exchangePattern.title: Exchange Pattern

pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.
pollStrategy.title: Poll Strategy

chatId.description: The identifier of the chat that will receive the produced messages. Chat ids can be first obtained from incoming messages (eg. when a telegram user starts a conversation with a bot, its client sends automatically a '/start' message containing the chat id). It is an optional parameter, as the chat id can be set dynamically for each outgoing message (using body or headers).
chatId.title: Chat Id

By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
lazyStartProducer.title: Lazy Start Producer

baseUri.description: Can be used to set an alternative base URI, e.g. when you want to test the component against a mock Telegram API
baseUri.title: Base Uri

bufferSize.description: The initial in-memory buffer size used when transferring data between Camel and AHC Client.
bufferSize.title: Buffer Size

proxyHost.description: HTTP proxy host which could be used when sending out the message.
proxyHost.title: Proxy Host

proxyPort.description: HTTP proxy port which could be used when sending out the message.
proxyPort.title: Proxy Port

proxyType.description: HTTP proxy type which could be used when sending out the message.
proxyType.title: Proxy Type

backoffErrorThreshold.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.
backoffErrorThreshold.title: Backoff Error Threshold

backoffIdleThreshold.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.
backoffIdleThreshold.title: Backoff Idle Threshold

backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.
backoffMultiplier.title: Backoff Multiplier

greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.
greedy.title: Greedy

initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.
initialDelay.title: Initial Delay

repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.
repeatCount.title: Repeat Count

runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.
runLoggingLevel.title: Run Logging Level

scheduledExecutorService.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.
scheduledExecutorService.title: Scheduled Executor Service

scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler
scheduler.title: Scheduler

schedulerProperties.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.
schedulerProperties.title: Scheduler Properties

startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.
startScheduler.title: Start Scheduler

timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.
timeUnit.title: Time Unit

useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.
useFixedDelay.title: Use Fixed Delay

authorizationToken.description: The authorization token for using the bot (ask the BotFather)
authorizationToken.title: Authorization Token

host.description: The Thrift server host name. This is localhost or 0.0.0.0 (if not defined) when being a consumer or remote server host name when using producer.

port.description: The Thrift server port

service.description: Fully qualified service name from the thrift descriptor file (package dot service definition name)
service.title: Service

maxPoolSize.description: The Thrift server consumer max thread pool size
maxPoolSize.title: Max Pool Size

fixedRate.description: Events take place at approximately regular intervals, separated by the specified period.

includeMetadata.description: Whether to include metadata in the exchange such as fired time, timer name, timer count etc. This information is default included.

period.description: If greater than 0, generate periodic events every period.
